      name:  <unnamed>
       log:  /home/urban/hcgrowth/empirics/code/logs/log_2023.06.16_19.03.32.tx
> t
  log type:  text
 opened on:  16 Jun 2023, 19:03:32

. timer clear

. di "Stata version: `c(stata_version)' `=cond( c(MP),"MP `c(processors)'",cond
> (c(SE),"SE",c(flavor)) )'"
Stata version: 18 MP 8

. di "Update level:  `c(born_date)'"
Update level:  07 Jun 2023

. di "OS:            `c(os)' `c(osdtl)'"
OS:            Unix 

. 
. * set flags here --------------------------------------------------------
. * to disable the part of the data construction that requires the 
. * restricted-access geocode nlsy79 data, set the following flag to 1;
. * note that, without the restricted-access geocode nlsy79 data,
. * no location data will be available, and it will not be possible to 
. * replicate our results; however, the nlsy79 panel generated may be 
. * useful for other projects;
. * enabling the part of the data construction that requires the 
. * restricted-access geocode nlsy79 data, involving the files:
. * data/src/nlsy/geocode/location-value-labels.do,
. * data/src/nlsy/geocode/survey_and_created_variables-value-labels.do
. * data/src/nlsy/geocode/location.dct
. * data/src/nlsy/geocode/survey_and_created_variables.dct
. global NLSYGeocodeUnavailable = 0

. * users without access to the geocode nlsy79 data that wish to check
. * that the replication code runs smoothly can set the following flag to 1;
. * this will randomly generate a fake location history for each respondent
. * that will allow the code to run but generate meaningless results with 
. * the same format but different values than the actual results in the article
. global NLSYGenerateFakeLocations = 0

. * to disable the part of the data construction that requires data on the
. * residence block group of households in nhts 2009, set the following flag to
>  1;
. * note that, without these restricted-access data, it will not be possible to
>  
. * replicate our results; enabling requires residence block group of household
> s 
. * in nhts 2009, involving the file:
. * data/src/nhts/geocode/HCTBG.CSV
. global NHTSBGUnavailable = 0

. * users without access to data on the residence block group of households in 
. * nhts 2009 that wish to check that the replication code runs smoothly can se
> t 
. * the following flag to 1; this will randomly generate a fake location for ea
> ch 
. * household that will allow the code to run but generate meaningless results 
> with 
. * the same format but different values than the actual results in the article
. global NHTSGenerateFakeLocations = 0

. * to disable the gis portion of the analysis, set the following flag to 1
. * (enabling requires python)
. global DisableGIS = 0

. * to re-do the geocoding of city centres, set the following flag to 1
. * (requires python); default is 0 for full replicability
. * (google maps occassionaly changes the coordinates slightly)
. global GeocodeAgain = 0

. * to install the required stata packages, set the following flag to 1
. global InstallPackages = 0

. *------------------------------------------------------------------------
. 
. * flag consistency check
. if ("$NLSYGenerateFakeLocations" == "1") {
.         global NLSYGeocodeUnavailable = 1
. }

. if ("$NHTSGenerateFakeLocations" == "1") {
.         global NHTSBGUnavailable = 1
. }

. * pass on flag to nlsy_panel.do
. if ("$NLSYGeocodeUnavailable" == "1") {
.         global NLSYDisableGeocode = 1
. }

. else {
.         global NLSYDisableGeocode = 0   
. }

. 
. * initialise
. clear all

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. 
. * define how to run python scripts
. global PythonRunScript "oscmd $PathConda run --no-capture-output python"

. * define how to list python package details
. global PythonPackageInfo "oscmd $PathConda list -f"

. 
. * shell replacement command under windows
. * (redirects stdout to results window and log also in windows)
. program define oscmd
  1.         version 7
  2.         if "`c(os)'" == "Windows" {
  3.         tempfile tmplogfile 
  4.                 ! `0' | out-file `tmplogfile' -encoding utf8
  5.                 type `"`tmplogfile'"' 
  6.         }
  7.         else {
  8.                 shell `0'
  9.         }
 10. end

. 
. * program to display timer results
. * first (optional) argument is an opening string to display
. * second argument is a number of seconds (typically from a timer) to be
. * formatted as days, hours, minutes, seconds
. program define formattimer
  1.         if "`2'" == "" {
  2.                 local tt `1'
  3.                 local tr ""
  4.         }
  5.         else {
  6.                 local tr = "`1'"
  7.                 local tt = `2'
  8.         }
  9.         local td = int(`tt' / (24 * 60 * 60))
 10.         local th = int((`tt' - (`td' * 24 * 60 * 60)) / (60 * 60))
 11.         local tm = int((`tt' - (`th' * 60 * 60) - (`td' * 24 * 60 * 60)) /
>  60)
 12.         local ts = int((`tt' - (`th' * 60 * 60)) - (`tm' * 60) - (`td' * 2
> 4 * 60 * 60))
 13.         if `td' > 0 {
 14.                 local tr "`tr' `td' day"
 15.                 if `td' > 1 {
 16.                         local tr "`tr's"
 17.                 }
 18.         }
 19.         if `th' > 0 {
 20.                 local tr "`tr' `th' hour"
 21.                 if `th' > 1 {
 22.                         local tr "`tr's"
 23.                 }
 24.         }
 25.         if `tm' > 0 {
 26.                 local tr "`tr' `tm' minute"
 27.                 if `tm' > 1 {
 28.                         local tr "`tr's"
 29.                 }
 30.         }
 31.         if `ts' > 0 {
 32.                 local tr "`tr' `ts' second"
 33.                 if `ts' > 1 {
 34.                         local tr "`tr's"
 35.                 }
 36.         }
 37.         display `"{res}`tr' "'
 38. end

. 
. * stata version control
. * make newer stata versions behave like 18
. if (`c(stata_version)' > 18) {
.         version 18
. }

. * version 14 or higher required for unicode support
. else {
.         version 14
. }

. 
. * set random-number seed
. set seed 954728

. 
. * optionally install required stata packages
. if ("$InstallPackages" == "1") {
.         ssc install estout, replace
.         ssc install grstyle, replace
.         ssc install ivreg2, replace
.         ssc install palettes, replace
.         ssc install ranktest, replace
.         ssc install regsave, replace
.         ssc install shp2dta, replace
.         ssc install ftools, replace
.         ssc install reghdfe, replace
.         ssc install ivreghdfe, replace
.         net install st0109.pkg, from(http://www.stata-journal.com/software/sj
> 6-3) replace
.         * plreg
. }

. display "Installed versions of required Stata packages:"
Installed versions of required Stata packages:

. ado describe estout

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[1] package estout from http://fmwww.bc.edu/repec/bocode/e
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TITLE
      'ESTOUT': module to make regression tables

DESCRIPTION/AUTHOR(S)
      
       estout produces a table of regression results from one or
      several models for use with spreadsheets, LaTeX, HTML, or a
      word-processor table. eststo stores a quick copy of the active
      estimation results for later tabulation. esttab is a wrapper for
      estout. It displays a pretty looking publication-style regression
      table without much typing. estadd adds additional results to the
      e()-returns for one or several models previously fitted and
      stored. This package subsumes the previously circulated esto,
      esta, estadd,  and estadd_plus. An earlier version of estout is
      available  as estout1.
      
      KW: estimates
      KW: LaTeX
      KW: HTML
      KW: word processor
      KW: output
      
      Requires: Stata version 8.2
      
      Distribution-Date: 20230212
      
      Author: Ben Jann, University of Bern
      Support: email jann@soz.unibe.ch
      

INSTALLATION FILES
      _/_eststo.ado
      _/_eststo.hlp
      e/estadd.ado
      e/estadd.hlp
      e/estout.ado
      e/estout.hlp
      e/eststo.ado
      e/eststo.hlp
      e/estpost.ado
      e/estpost.hlp
      e/esttab.ado
      e/esttab.hlp

INSTALLED ON
      31 May 2023
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

. ado describe grstyle

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[2] package grstyle from http://fmwww.bc.edu/repec/bocode/g
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TITLE
      'GRSTYLE': module to customize the overall look of graphs

DESCRIPTION/AUTHOR(S)
      
       grstyle allows you to customize the overall look of graphs from
      within a do-file without having to fiddle around with external
      scheme files. The advantage of grstyle over manually editing a
      scheme file is that everything needed to reproduce your graphs
      can be included in a single do-file.
      
      KW: graphics
      KW: scheme files
      KW: custom graphics
      KW: plot
      
      Requires: Stata version 9.2 and palettes from SSC (q.v.)
      
      Distribution-Date: 20200919
      
      Author: Ben Jann, University of Bern
      Support: email jann@soz.unibe.ch
      

INSTALLATION FILES
      g/grstyle.ado
      g/grstyle.hlp
      g/grstyle_set.ado
      g/grstyle_set.hlp

. ado describe ivreg2

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[3] package ivreg2 from http://fmwww.bc.edu/repec/bocode/i
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TITLE
      'IVREG2': module for extended instrumental variables/2SLS and GMM
        estimation

DESCRIPTION/AUTHOR(S)
      
       ivreg2 provides extensions to Stata's official ivregress and
      newey. Its main capabilities: two-step feasible GMM estimation;
      continuously updated GMM estimation (CUE); LIML and k-class
      estimation; automatic output of the Hansen-Sargan or
      Anderson-Rubin statistic for overidentifying restrictions; C
      statistic test of exogeneity of subsets of instruments (orthog()
      option); kernel-based autocorrelation-consistent (AC) and
      heteroskedastic and autocorrelation-consistent (HAC) estimation,
      with user-specified choice of kernel; Cragg's "heteroskedastic
      OLS" (HOLS) estimator; default reporting of large-sample
      statistics (z and chi-squared rather than t and F); small option
      to report small-sample statistics; first-stage regression
      reported with F-test of excluded instruments and R-squared with
      included instruments "partialled-out"; enhanced Kleibergen-Paap
      and Cragg-Donald tests for weak instruments, redundancy of
      instruments, significance of endogenous regressors; two-way
      clustering of standard errors;  Kiefer and Driscoll-Kraay
      standard errors. ivreg2 can also be used for ordinary least
      squares (OLS) estimation using the same command syntax as Stata's
      official regress and newey. New in this version: ivreg2 now
      supports factor variables. This is version 4.1.11 of ivreg2,
      updated from that published in Stata Journal, 5(4), requiring
      Stata 11.2 or better. Stata 8.2/9.2/10.2 users may use this
      routine, which will  automatically call ivreg28, ivreg29, or
      ivreg210, respectively. These versions are now included in the
      ivreg2 package. Stata 7 users may use the Stata Journal version
      of ivreg2, accessible via net search ivreg2.
      
      KW: instrumental variables
      KW: Sargan test
      KW: robust estimation
      KW: orthogonality
      KW: GMM
      KW: Hansen's J
      KW: heteroskedastic OLS,
      
      Requires: Stata version 11.2 and ranktest from SSC
      
      Distribution-Date: 20220510
      
      Author: Christopher F Baum, Boston College
      Support: email baum@bc.edu
      
      Author: Mark E Schaffer, Heriot-Watt University
      Support: email m.e.schaffer@hw.ac.uk
      
      Author: Steven Stillman, Free University of Bozen-Bolzano
      Support: email  Steven.Stillman@unibz.it
      

INSTALLATION FILES
      i/ivreg2.ado
      i/ivreg2.sthlp
      i/ivreg2_p.ado
      l/livreg2.mlib
      i/ivreg210.ado
      i/ivreg210.sthlp
      i/ivreg210_p.ado
      i/ivreg29.ado
      i/ivreg29.hlp
      i/ivreg29_p.ado
      i/ivreg29_cue.ado
      i/ivreg28.ado
      i/ivreg28.hlp
      i/ivreg28_p.ado
      i/ivreg28_cue.ado

INSTALLED ON
      31 May 2023
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

. ado describe ranktest

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[5] package ranktest from http://fmwww.bc.edu/repec/bocode/r
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TITLE
      'RANKTEST': module to test the rank of a matrix

DESCRIPTION/AUTHOR(S)
      
       ranktest implements various tests for the rank of a matrix.
      Tests of the rank of a matrix have many practical applications.
      For example, in econometrics the requirement for identification
      is the rank condition, which states that a particular matrix must
      be of full column rank. Another example from econometrics
      concerns cointegration in vector autoregressive (VAR) models; the
      Johansen trace test is a test of a rank of a particular matrix.
      The traditional test of the rank of a matrix for the standard
      (stationary) case is the Anderson (1951) canonical correlations
      test. If we denote one list of variables as Y and a second as Z,
      and we calculate the squared canonical correlations between Y and
      Z, the LM form of the Anderson test, where the null hypothesis is
      that the matrix of correlations or regression parameters B
      between Y and Z has rank(B)=r, is N times the sum of the r+1
      largest squared canonical correlations. A large test statistic
      and rejection of the null indicates that the matrix has rank at
      least r+1. The Cragg-Donald (1993) statistic is a closely related
      Wald test for the rank of a matrix. The standard versions of
      these tests require the assumption that the covariance matrix has
      a Kronecker form; when this is not so, e.g., when disturbances
      are heteroskedastic or autocorrelated, the test statistics are no
      longer valid. ranktest implements various generalizations of
      these tests - Kleibergen-Paap, Cragg-Donald, and J-type 2-step
      GMM and CUE GMM tests - to the case of a non-Kronecker covariance
      matrix. The implementation in ranktest will calculate test
      statistics that are robust to various forms of
      heteroskedasticity, autocorrelation, and clustering.
      
      KW: matrix
      KW: rank
      KW: collinearity
      KW: cointegration
      
      Requires: Stata version 12 (version 9.2 for ranktest9, version 11 for ran
> ktest11)
      
      Distribution-Date: 20200929
      
      Author: Frank Kleibergen, Brown University
      Support: email  Frank_Kleibergen@brown.edu
      
      Author: Mark E Schaffer, Heriot-Watt University
      Support: email m.e.schaffer@hw.ac.uk
      
      Author: Frank Windmeijer, University of Oxford
      Support: email frank.windmeijer@stats.ox.ac.uk
      

INSTALLATION FILES
      r/ranktest.ado
      r/ranktest9.ado
      r/ranktest11.ado
      r/ranktest.sthlp
      r/ranktest11.sthlp
      l/livreg2.mlib

INSTALLED ON
      31 May 2023
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

. ado describe regsave

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[6] package regsave from http://fmwww.bc.edu/repec/bocode/r
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TITLE
      'REGSAVE': module to save regression results to a Stata-formatted dataset

DESCRIPTION/AUTHOR(S)
      
       regsave fetches output from Stata's e() macros, scalars, and
      matrices and stores them in  a Stata-formatted dataset. This
      command provides a user-friendly way to manipulate a large number
       of regression results by allowing the user to apply Stata's data
      manipulation commands to those  results. When combined with the
      table option and the outsheet command, it also provides an easy
      way to create tables that can be opened by, or copy and pasted
      into, other programs such as MS Excel.
      
      KW: regression
      KW: output
      KW: tables
      KW: formatting
      KW: outsheet
      
      Requires: Stata version 8
      
      Distribution-Date: 20200412
      
      Author: Julian Reif , University of Illinois
      Support: email jreif@illinois.edu
      

INSTALLATION FILES
      r/regsave.ado
      r/regsave_tbl.ado
      r/regsave.hlp
      r/regsave_tbl.hlp

INSTALLED ON
      31 May 2023
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

. ado describe shp2dta

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[7] package shp2dta from http://fmwww.bc.edu/repec/bocode/s
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TITLE
      'SHP2DTA': module to converts shape boundary files to Stata datasets

DESCRIPTION/AUTHOR(S)
      
       shp2dta reads a shape (.shp) and dbase (.dbf) file from disk and
      converts them into Stata datasets.  The shape and dbase files
      must have the same name and be saved in the same directory.  The
      user-written command tmap can use the two datasets that shp2dta
      creates. shp2dta can convert only polygon shapefiles (type 5).
      
      KW: tmap
      KW: shape files
      KW: maps
      
      Requires: Stata version 9.1
      
      Distribution-Date: 20150717
      
      Author: Kevin Crow , StataCorp LP
      Support: email kcrow@stata.com
      

INSTALLATION FILES
      s/shp2dta.ado
      s/shp2dta.hlp
      s/shp2dta.dlg

INSTALLED ON
      31 May 2023
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

. ado describe ftools

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[8] package ftools from http://fmwww.bc.edu/repec/bocode/f
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TITLE
      'FTOOLS': module to provide alternatives to common Stata commands
        optimized for large datasets

DESCRIPTION/AUTHOR(S)
      
       ftools consists of a Mata file and several Stata commands: The
      Mata file creates identifiers (factors) from variables by using
      hash functions instead of sorting the data, so it runs in time
      O(N) and not in O(N log N). The Stata commands exploit this to
      avoid sort operations,  at the cost of being slower for small
      datasets (mainly because of the cost involved in moving data from
      Stata to Mata). Implemented commands are fcollapse, fegen group,
      and fsort. Note that most of the capabilities of levels and
      contract are already supported by these commands. Possible
      commands include more egen functions and merge and reshape
      alternatives.
      
      KW: levels
      KW: collapse
      KW: contract
      KW: egen
      KW: sort
      KW: factor variables
      KW: Mata
      
      Requires: Stata version 11.2
      
      Distribution-Date: 20191118
      
      Author: Sergio Correia, Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System
      Support: email sergio.correia@gmail.com
      

INSTALLATION FILES
      f/ftools.ado
      f/ftools.mata
      f/ftools.sthlp
      f/fcollapse.ado
      f/fcollapse.sthlp
      f/fegen.ado
      f/fegen_group.ado
      f/fegen.sthlp
      f/fisid.ado
      f/fisid.sthlp
      f/flevelsof.ado
      f/flevelsof.sthlp
      f/fmerge.ado
      f/fmerge.sthlp
      f/freshape.ado
      f/fsort.ado
      f/fsort.sthlp
      f/ftab.ado
      j/join.ado
      j/join.sthlp
      l/local_inlist.ado
      l/local_inlist.sthlp
      f/fcollapse_functions.mata
      f/fcollapse_main.mata
      f/ftools_type_aliases.mata
      f/ftools.mata
      f/ftools_common.mata
      f/ftools_hash1.mata
      f/ftools_main.mata
      f/ftools_experimental.mata
      f/ftools_plugin.mata
      f/ftools_type_aliases.mata
      m/ms_compile_mata.ado
      m/ms_expand_varlist.ado
      m/ms_fvstrip.ado
      m/ms_fvstrip.sthlp
      m/ms_fvunab.ado
      m/ms_get_version.ado
      m/ms_parse_absvars.ado
      m/ms_parse_varlist.ado
      m/ms_parse_vce.ado
      m/ms_add_comma.ado

INSTALLED ON
      31 May 2023

. 
. * list details of installed python packages
. * note these need to be installed manually depending on your system, e.g.:
. * conda install -c conda-forge dask dask-geopandas distributed gdal geopandas
>  libspatialindex matplotlib numba rasterio rasterstats requests rioxarray sci
> kit-learn typing xarray-spatial 
. if ("$GeocodeAgain" == "1" | "$DisableGIS" == "0") {

.         $PythonPackageInfo gdal

# Name                    Version                   Build  Channel

.         $PythonPackageInfo geopandas

# packages in environment at /usr/local/miniconda3:

.         
. * create directories for output files if needed
. cap mkdir "$PathProjectRoot/data/intermediate"

. cap mkdir "$PathProjectRoot/data/processed"

. cap mkdir "$PathProjectRoot/results"

. 
. * graphics settings
. set scheme s2color

. grstyle init

. grstyle color background     white

. grstyle linestyle plotregion none

. grstyle linestyle grid       none

. grstyle linestyle major_grid none

. grstyle linestyle minor_grid none

. grstyle set graphsize 11.2cm 14cm

. grstyle set size 11pt: axis_title body

. grstyle set size 8pt: subheading

. grstyle set margin tiny: subheading

. grstyle set size 8pt: tick_label

. grstyle anglestyle vertical_tick vertical

. grstyle textboxstyle leg_caption subheading

. graph set eps logo off

. graph set eps fontface Palatino

. 
. * construct datasets from raw sources
. cd "$PathProjectRoot/code"
/home/urban/hcgrowth/empirics/code

. timer on 1

. do 1_hcgrowth_builddata.do

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
> 1_hcgrowth_buildddata.do
> 
> Stata do file to perform data construction for
> 'Urban growth and its aggregate implications',
> by Gilles Duranton and Diego Puga, Econometrica
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
. 
. * initialise
. clear

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. 
. cd builddata
/home/urban/hcgrowth/empirics/code/builddata

. 
. ** US nation totals: GDP per capita, schooling, CPI
. do us_nation_totals

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
> us_nation_totals.do
> 
> Stata do file to construct US national aggregate data for
> 'Urban growth and its aggregate implications',
> by Gilles Duranton and Diego Puga
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
. 
. * initialise
. clear

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. 
. tempfile tmp

. 
. * gdp per capita
. * source data:
. * https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/A939RX0Q048SBEA
. import excel ../../data/src/fred/A939RX0Q048SBEA.xls, firstrow cellrange(A11)
>  case(lower) clear
(2 vars, 301 obs)

. rename a939rx0q048sbea us_gdp_pc

. keep if month(observation_date) == 1
(225 observations deleted)

. gen year = year(observation_date)

. keep year us_gdp_pc

. save `tmp', replace
(file /tmp/St10336.000001 not found)
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. 
. * average years of school
. * source data: https://www2.census.gov/programs-surveys/demo/tables/education
> al-attainment/time-series/cps-historical-time-series/taba-1.xlsx
. import excel ../../data/src/cps/cps_historical_table_a1.xlsx, cellrange(A8:H7
> 4) clear
(8 vars, 67 obs)

. rename (A B C D E F G H) (year edu_total edu_elem_0_4 edu_elem_5_8 edu_hs_1_3
>  edu_hs_4 edu_col_1_3 edu_col_4_plus)

. destring year, replace
year: all characters numeric; replaced as int

. gen us_ayschool = (edu_elem_0_4 * 4 + edu_elem_5_8 * 8 + edu_hs_1_3 * 11 + ed
> u_hs_4 * 12 + edu_col_1_3 * 14 + edu_col_4_plus * 16)/edu_total

. keep year us_ayschool

. merge 1:1 year using `tmp'
(variable year was int, now float to accommodate using data's values)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                            11
        from master                         1  (_merge==1)
        from using                         10  (_merge==2)

    Matched                                66  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. drop _merge

. save `tmp', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. 
. * cpi
. ** adjust nominal values for inflation (cpi 1982-1984 = 100)
. * source data:
. * https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPIAUCNS
. import excel ../../data/src/fred/CPIAUCNS.xls, cellrange(A12) clear
(2 vars, 1,324 obs)

. rename (A B) (date cpi)

. gen month = month(date)

. gen year = year(date)

. keep if month == 12
(1,214 observations deleted)

. drop date month

. merge 1:1 year using `tmp'

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                            33
        from master                        33  (_merge==1)
        from using                          0  (_merge==2)

    Matched                                77  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. drop _merge

. save `tmp', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. 
. * label and save
. sort year

. keep if year == 1950 | year == 1960 | year >= 1965
(50 observations deleted)

. order year us_gdp_pc us_ayschool cpi

. label var year "Year"

. label var us_gdp_pc "Real gross domestic product per person, United States (2
> 012 $)"

. label var us_ayschool "Average years of school completed by people aged >25, 
> United States"

. label var cpi "Consumer Price Index, all urban consumers (1982-1984 = 100)"

. label data "'Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. US
>  totals"

. compress
  variable year was float now int
  (120 bytes saved)

. save ../../data/processed/us_nation_totals, replace
(file ../../data/processed/us_nation_totals.dta not found)
file ../../data/processed/us_nation_totals.dta saved

. describe, fullnames

Contains data from ../../data/processed/us_nation_totals.dta
 Observations:            60                  'Urban growth and its aggregate
                                                implications' Duranton & Puga.
                                                US totals
    Variables:             4                  16 Jun 2023 19:04

    name         type    format    label      Variable label

                                                person, United States (2012 $)

                                                by people aged >25, United
                                                States
cpi             double  %10.0g                Consumer Price Index, all urban
                                                consumers (1982-1984 = 100)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sorted by: year

. 
end of do-file

. sort fips

. save ../../data/processed/county2msa1999, replace
(file ../../data/processed/county2msa1999.dta not found)
file ../../data/processed/county2msa1999.dta saved

. describe, fullnames

. /* county population 1850, 1920 */
. *
. * historical population estimates for 2010 u.s. states, counties and metro/mi
> cro areas, 1790-2010
. * creator: jonathan p. schroeder minnesota population center
. * http://doi.org/10.13020/D6XW2H
. import excel ../../data/src/citypop/county2010_hist_pops.xlsx, firstrow case(
> lower) clear
(27 vars, 3,143 obs)

. rename geoid10 fips

. destring fips, replace
fips: all characters numeric; replaced as long

. rename epop* pop*

. gen name_h = county + " " + state

. * drop hawaii, alaska
. drop if state == "Hawaii"
(5 observations deleted)

. drop if state == "Alaska"
(29 observations deleted)

. keep fips name_h pop1850-pop1920

. * add population of Broomfield (new county in Colorado) to Jefferson
. replace fips = 8059 if fips == 8014
(1 real change made)

. collapse (sum) pop*, by(fips)

. gen state = int(fips / 1000)

. forval n = 185/192 {
  2.         local y = 10*`n'
  3.         replace pop`y' = round(pop`y')
  4. }
(1,629 real changes made)
(1,552 real changes made)
(1,539 real changes made)
(1,199 real changes made)
(940 real changes made)
(877 real changes made)
(663 real changes made)
(411 real changes made)

. * generate state totals
. preserve

. collapse (sum) pop*, by(state)

. gen long fips = int(state * 1000)

. save `tmp', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. restore

. append using `tmp'

. save `tmp', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. 
. /* county population 1950, 1980, 1990 */
. *
. * census u.s. decennial county population data, 1900-1990
. * doc: https://www.census.gov/population/cencounts/00-90doc.txt
. * import delimited using http://www.nber.org/census/pop/cencounts.csv
. import delimited using ../../data/src/citypop/cencounts.csv, delimiters(",") 
> varnames(1) clear
(12 vars, 3,223 obs)

. * drop us aggregate
. drop if fips == 0
(1 observation deleted)

. * Dade County, Florida (12025)renamed as Miami-Dade County (12086) effective 
> July 22, 1997
. replace fips = 12086 if fips == 12025
(1 real change made)

. replace name = "FL Miami-Dade County" if fips == 12086
(1 real change made)

. * South Boston (independent) city, Virginia (51780) changed to town status an
> d added to Halifax County (51083) effective June 30, 1995
. replace fips = 51083 if fips == 51780
(1 real change made)

. replace name = "VA Halifax County" if fips == 51083
(1 real change made)

. * Yellowstone National Park (county equivalent), Montana (30113) annexed to G
> allatin (30031) and Park (30067) counties effective November 7, 1997
. replace fips = 30067 if fips == 30113
(1 real change made)

. replace name = "MT Park County" if fips == 30067
(1 real change made)

. * aggregate by county
. collapse (sum) pop*, by(fips name)

. gen state = int(fips / 1000)

. * drop puerto rico, hawaii, alaska
. drop if state == 72
(0 observations deleted)

. drop if state == 15
(6 observations deleted)

. drop if state == 2
(39 observations deleted)

. compress
  variable state was float now byte
  variable pop1900 was double now long
  variable pop1910 was double now long
  variable pop1920 was double now long
  variable pop1930 was double now long
  variable pop1940 was double now long
  variable pop1950 was double now long
  variable pop1960 was double now long
  variable pop1970 was double now long
  variable pop1980 was double now long
  variable pop1990 was double now long
  (136,525 bytes saved)

. drop pop1900 pop1910 pop1920

. * combine population data
. merge 1:1 fips using `tmp'
(variable fips was float, now double to accommodate using data's values)
(variable state was byte, now float to accommodate using data's values)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------

        from master                        18  (_merge==1)
        from using                          0  (_merge==2)

    Matched                             3,157  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

            Matched (3) |      3,157       99.43      100.00
------------------------+-----------------------------------
                  Total |      3,175      100.00

. keep fips state pop*

. aorder pop*

. order fips state

. compress
  variable state was float now byte
  variable pop1850 was double now long
  variable pop1860 was double now long
  variable pop1870 was double now long
  variable pop1880 was double now long
  variable pop1890 was double now long
  variable pop1900 was double now long
  variable pop1910 was double now long

. /* county population 2000 */
. *
. * 2000 county decennial census data from nhgis
. * county-level data
. cd ../../data/src/citypop
/home/urban/hcgrowth/empirics/data/src/citypop

. do nhgis0035_ds146_2000_county.do

. * NOTE: You need to set the Stata working directory to the path
. * where the data file is located.
. 
. set more off

. 
. clear

. quietly infix                 ///
>   str     year       1-4      ///
>   str     regiona    5-5      ///
>   str     divisiona  6-6      ///
>   str     state      7-30     ///
>   str     statea     31-32    ///
>   str     county     33-89    ///
>   str     countya    90-92    ///
>   str     cty_suba   93-97    ///
>   str     placea     98-102   ///
>   str     tracta     103-108  ///
>   str     trbl_cta   109-114  ///
>   str     blck_grpa  115-115  ///
>   str     trbl_bga   116-116  ///
>   str     c_citya    117-121  ///
>   str     aianhha    122-125  ///
>   str     res_onlya  126-129  ///
>   str     trusta     130-133  ///
>   str     trbl_suba  134-138  ///
>   str     anrca      139-143  ///
>   str     msa_cmsaa  144-147  ///
>   str     pmsaa      148-151  ///
>   str     necmaa     152-155  ///
>   str     urb_areaa  156-160  ///
>   str     cd106a     161-162  ///
>   str     cd108a     163-164  ///
>   str     cd109a     165-166  ///
>   str     zip3a      167-169  ///
>   str     zctaa      170-174  ///
>   str     name       175-264  ///
>   double  fl5001     265-273  ///
>   using `"nhgis0035_ds146_2000_county.dat"'

. 
. 
. format fl5001    %9.0f

. 
. label var year      `"Data File Year"'

. label var regiona   `"Region Code"'

. label var divisiona `"Division Code"'

. label var state     `"State Name"'

. label var statea    `"State Code"'

. label var county    `"County Name"'

. label var countya   `"County Code"'

. label var cty_suba  `"County Subdivision Code"'

. label var placea    `"Place Code"'

. label var tracta    `"Census Tract Code"'

. label var trbl_cta  `"Tribal Census Tract Code"'

. label var blck_grpa `"Block Group Code"'

. label var trbl_bga  `"Tribal Block Group Code"'

. label var c_citya   `"Consolidated City Code"'

. label var aianhha   `"American Indian Area/Alaska Native Area/Hawaiian Home L
> and Code"'

. label var res_onlya `"American Indian Reservation [excluding trust lands] Cod
> e"'

. label var trusta    `"American Indian Reservation [trust lands only] Code"'

. label var trbl_suba `"Tribal Subdivision Code"'

. label var anrca     `"Alaska Native Regional Corporation Code"'

. label var msa_cmsaa `"Metropolitan Statistical Area/Consolidated Metropolitan
>  Statistical Area Code"'

. label var pmsaa     `"Primary Metropolitan Statistical Area Code"'

. label var necmaa    `"New England County Metropolitan Area Code"'

. label var urb_areaa `"Urban Area Code"'

. label var cd106a    `"Congressional District (106th) Code"'

. label var cd108a    `"Congressional District (108th) Code"'

. label var cd109a    `"Congressional District (109th) Code"'

. label var zip3a     `"3-Digit Zip Code Tabulation Area Code"'

. label var zctaa     `"5-Digit Zip Code Tabulation Area Code"'

. label var name      `"Area Name-Legal/Statistical Area Description (LSAD) Ter
> m-Part Indicator"'

. label var fl5001    `"Total"'

. 
. 
. 
end of do-file

. destring statea countya, replace
statea: all characters numeric; replaced as byte
countya: all characters numeric; replaced as int

. rename state state_name

. rename county county_name

. rename statea state

. rename countya county

. rename fl5001 pop2000

. gen long fips = state * 1000 + county

. label var nectaa    `"New England City and Town Area Code"'

. label var nectadiva `"NECTA Division Code"'

. label var cnectaa   `"Combined New England City and Town Area Code"'

. label var uaa       `"Urban Area Code"'

. label var urbrurala `"Urban/Rural Code"'

. label var cda       `"Congressional District (111th Congress) Code"'

. label var sldua     `"State Legislative District (Upper Chamber) Code"'

. label var sldla     `"State Legislative District (Lower Chamber) Code"'

. label var zcta5a    `"5-Digit Zip Code Tabulation Area Code"'

. label var submcda   `"Subminor Civil Division Code"'

. label var sdelma    `"School District (Elementary)/Remainder Code"'

. label var sdseca    `"School District (Secondary)/Remainder Code"'

. label var sdunia    `"School District (Unified)/Remainder Code"'

. label var name      `"Area Name-Legal/Statistical Area Description (LSAD) Ter
> m-Part Indicator"'

. label var sabinsa   `"School Attendance Area Code"'

. label var h7v001    `"Total"'

. 
. 
. 
end of do-file

. destring statea, replace
statea: all characters numeric; replaced as byte

. rename state state_name

. rename statea state

. rename h7v001 pop2010

. gen long fips = int(state * 1000)

. * aggregate by county
. collapse (sum) pop*, by(fips state)

. * drop puerto rico, hawaii, alaska
. drop if state == 72
(1 observation deleted)

. drop if state == 15
(1 observation deleted)

. drop if state == 2
(1 observation deleted)

. * combine population data
. merge 1:1 fips using `tmp'
(variable fips was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                         3,126
        from master                         0  (_merge==1)
        from using                      3,126  (_merge==2)

    Matched                                49  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. tab _merge

   Matching result from |
                  merge |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------------------+-----------------------------------
         Using only (2) |      3,126       98.46       98.46
            Matched (3) |         49        1.54      100.00
------------------------+-----------------------------------
                  Total |      3,175      100.00

. keep fips state pop*

. aorder pop*

. order fips state

. compress
  variable pop2010 was double now long
  (12,700 bytes saved)

. save `tmp', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. cd ../../../code/builddata
/home/urban/hcgrowth/empirics/code/builddata

.

/home/urban/hcgrowth/empirics/data/src/citypop

. destring statea countya, replace
statea: all characters numeric; replaced as byte
countya: all characters numeric; replaced as int

. rename state state_name

. rename county county_name

. rename statea state

. rename countya county

. rename u7b001 pop2020

. gen long fips = state * 1000 + county

. * add population of Broomfield (new county in Colorado) to Jefferson
. replace fips = 8059 if fips == 8014
(1 real change made)

. * Shannon County (South Dakota) renamed Oglala Lakota County in 2015
. replace fips = 46113 if fips == 46102
(1 real change made)

. * aggregate by county
. collapse (sum) pop*, by(fips state)

. * drop puerto rico, hawaii, alaska
. drop if state == 72
(78 observations deleted)

. drop if state == 15
(5 observations deleted)

. drop if state == 2
(30 observations deleted)

. * combine population data
. merge 1:1 fips using `tmp'
(variable fips was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                            68
        from master                         0  (_merge==1)
        from using                         68  (_merge==2)

    Matched                             3,107  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. tab _merge

   Matching result from |
                  merge |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------------------+-----------------------------------
         Using only (2) |         68        2.14        2.14
            Matched (3) |      3,107       97.86      100.00
------------------------+-----------------------------------
                  Total |      3,175      100.00

. keep fips state pop*

. aorder pop*

. order fips state

. compress
  variable pop2020 was double now long
  (12,700 bytes saved)

. save `tmp', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. * add state totals
. do nhgis0035_ds248_2020_state.do

. * NOTE: You need to set the Stata working directory to the path
. * where the data file is located.
. 
. set more off

. 
. clear

. quietly infix                   ///
>   str     year       1-4        ///
>   str     geoid      5-64       ///
>   str     geocode    65-115     ///
>   str     regiona    116-116    ///
>   str     divisiona  117-117    ///

>   str     blocka     178-181    ///

>   str     res_onlya  186-189    ///
>   str     trusta     190-193    ///

>   str     aitsa      196-198    ///
>   str     anrca      199-203    ///

. destring statea, replace
statea: all characters numeric; replaced as byte

. rename state state_name

. rename statea state

. rename u7b001 pop2020

. gen long fips = int(state * 1000)

. * aggregate by county
. collapse (sum) pop*, by(fips state)

. * drop puerto rico, hawaii, alaska
. drop if state == 72
(1 observation deleted)

. drop if state == 15
(1 observation deleted)

. drop if state == 2
(1 observation deleted)

. * combine population data
. merge 1:1 fips using `tmp'
(variable fips was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                         3,126
        from master                         0  (_merge==1)
        from using                      3,126  (_merge==2)

    Matched                                49  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. tab _merge

   Matching result from |
                  merge |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------------------+-----------------------------------
         Using only (2) |      3,126       98.46       98.46
            Matched (3) |         49        1.54      100.00
------------------------+-----------------------------------
                  Total |      3,175      100.00

. keep fips state pop*

. aorder pop*

. order fips state

. compress
  variable pop2020 was double now long
  (12,700 bytes saved)

. save `tmp', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. cd ../../../code/builddata
/home/urban/hcgrowth/empirics/code/builddata

. 
. /* msa population */
. *
. * recode missing to 0 (having checked them)
. mvencode pop*, mv(0) override
     pop1850: 18 missing values recoded
     pop1860: 18 missing values recoded
     pop1870: 18 missing values recoded
     pop1880: 18 missing values recoded
     pop1890: 18 missing values recoded
     pop1900: 18 missing values recoded
     pop1910: 18 missing values recoded
     pop1920: 18 missing values recoded
     pop2000: 17 missing values recoded
     pop2010: 18 missing values recoded
     pop2020: 19 missing values recoded

. * calculate national conterminous population from state totals
. preserve

. keep if state*1000 == fips
(3,126 observations deleted)

. collapse (sum) pop*

. gen long fips = 0

. save `tmp', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. restore

. append using `tmp'
(variable pop1850 was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)
(variable pop1860 was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)
(variable pop1870 was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)

(variable pop1920 was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)
(variable pop1930 was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)
(variable pop1940 was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)
(variable pop1950 was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)
(variable pop1960 was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)
(variable pop1970 was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)
(variable pop1980 was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)
(variable pop1990 was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)
(variable pop2000 was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)
(variable pop2010 was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)
(variable pop2020 was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)

. * drop state totals
. drop if state*1000 == fips
(49 observations deleted)

. save `tmp', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. * aggregate population by msa
. use ../../data/processed/county2msa1999, clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. City Definition
> s )

. keep if !missing(msa)
(0 observations deleted)

. merge 1:1 fips using `tmp'
(variable fips was long, now double to accommodate using data's values)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                         2,281
        from master                         0  (_merge==1)
        from using                      2,281  (_merge==2)

    Matched                               846  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. keep if !missing(msa) | fips == 0
(2,280 observations deleted)

. *mvencode pop*, mv(0)
. compress
  variable fips was double now long
  variable pop1850 was double now long
  variable pop1860 was double now long
  variable pop1870 was double now long
  variable pop1880 was double now long
  variable pop1890 was double now long
  variable pop1900 was double now long
  variable pop1910 was double now long
  variable pop1920 was double now long
  variable pop1930 was double now long
  variable pop1940 was double now long
  variable pop1950 was double now long
  variable pop1960 was double now long
  variable pop1970 was double now long
  variable pop1980 was double now long
  variable pop1990 was double now long
  variable pop2000 was double now long
  variable pop2010 was double now long
  variable pop2020 was double now long
  (64,372 bytes saved)

. format pop* %9.0f

. preserve

. * first aggregate to pmsa
. collapse (sum) pop*, by(msa msa_name pmsa pmsa_name)

. drop if missing(msa)
(1 observation deleted)

. * labels
. label var msa "MSA/CMSA/NECMA FIPS code (1999 definitions)"

. label var msa_name "MSA/CMSA/NECMA name"

. label var pmsa "PMSA FIPS code (1999 definitions)"

. label var pmsa_name "PMSA name"

. foreach y in 1850 1920 1930 1940 1950 1960 1970 1980 1990 2000 2010 2020 {
  2.         label var pop`y' "Population `y'"
  3. }

. label data "'Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. PM
> SA Sizes USA"

. compress
  variable pop1850 was double now long
  variable pop1860 was double now long
  variable pop1870 was double now long
  variable pop1880 was double now long
  variable pop1890 was double now long
  variable pop1900 was double now long
  variable pop1910 was double now long
  variable pop1920 was double now long
  variable pop1930 was double now long
  variable pop1940 was double now long
  variable pop1950 was double now long
  variable pop1960 was double now long
  variable pop1970 was double now long
  variable pop1980 was double now long
  variable pop1990 was double now long
  variable pop2000 was double now long
  variable pop2010 was double now long
  variable pop2020 was double now long
  (22,752 bytes saved)

. aorder pop*

. drop pop1860-pop1910

. order msa msa_name pmsa pmsa_name

. sort msa pmsa

. save ../../data/processed/citypop_pmsa, replace
(file ../../data/processed/citypop_pmsa.dta not found)
file ../../data/processed/citypop_pmsa.dta saved

. describe, fullnames

. * then to msa

> tly different coordinates)

> ta/intermediate/msa1999_geocoded.csv
. if ("$GeocodeAgain" == "1") {
.         * get main city name
.         use ../../data/processed/county2msa1999, clear
.         keep msa msa_name
.         duplicates drop
.         split msa_name, parse(,)
.         split msa_name1, parse(-)
.         gen state = substr(msa_name2,1,3)
.         gen msa_maincity = msa_name11 + "," + state if (strlen(state) == 3)
.         replace msa_maincity = msa_name11 if (strlen(state) != 3)
.         keep msa msa_name msa_maincity
.         sort msa
.         outsheet using ../../data/intermediate/msa1999.csv, replace comma
.         * get city centres from google
.         cd ../../data/intermediate
.         $PythonRunScript ../../code/builddata/python/1_batch_geocoding.py
.         cd ../../code/builddata
.         erase ../../data/intermediate/msa1999.csv
. }

>  clear

. * assemble block-group controls
. do controls_blockg

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
> controls_blockg.do
> 
> Stata do file to construct 2000 and 2012 block-group-level controls for
> 'Urban growth and its aggregate implications',
> by Gilles Duranton and Diego Puga
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
. 
. * initialise
. clear

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. 
. tempfile tmp

. tempfile tmpshp

. 
. ** block group identifiers, coordinates, and area, 2000
. * read block group boundary shapefile downloaded from https://www.nhgis.org
. shp2dta using ../../data/src/gis/boundaries/US_blck_grp_2000.shp, database(".
> ./../data/intermediate/US_blck_grp_2000_shp") coordinates(`tmpshp') replace
type: 5

. use ../../data/intermediate/US_blck_grp_2000_shp, clear

. erase ../../data/intermediate/US_blck_grp_2000_shp.dta

. foreach v of varlist _all {
  2.   capture rename `v' `=lower("`v'")'
  3. }

. * rename variables
. gen state = substr(fipsstco,1,2)

. gen county = substr(fipsstco,3,3)

. rename group blkg

. rename latitude blkg_lat

. rename longitude blkg_lon

. rename shape_area blkg_area

. destring state county tract blkg, replace
state: all characters numeric; replaced as byte
county: all characters numeric; replaced as int
tract: all characters numeric; replaced as long
blkg: all characters numeric; replaced as byte

. order state county tract blkg gisjoin blkg_lat blkg_lon blkg_area

. keep state county tract blkg gisjoin blkg_lat blkg_lon blkg_area

. save ../../data/processed/controls_blockg_2000, replace
(file ../../data/processed/controls_blockg_2000.dta not found)
file ../../data/processed/controls_blockg_2000.dta saved

. 
. ** block group identifiers, coordinates, and area, 2012
. * read block group boundary shapefile downloaded from https://www.nhgis.org
. shp2dta using ../../data/src/gis/boundaries/US_blck_grp_2012.shp, database(".
> ./../data/intermediate/US_blck_grp_2012_shp") coordinates(`tmpshp') replace
type: 5

. use ../../data/intermediate/US_blck_grp_2012_shp, clear

. erase ../../data/intermediate/US_blck_grp_2012_shp.dta

. foreach v of varlist _all {
  2.   capture rename `v' `=lower("`v'")'
  3. }

. * rename and label variables
. rename statefp state

. rename countyfp county

. rename tractce tract

. rename blkgrpce blkg

. rename intptlat blkg_lat

. rename intptlon blkg_lon

. rename aland blkg_area

. destring state county tract blkg blkg_lat blkg_lon, replace
state: all characters numeric; replaced as byte
county: all characters numeric; replaced as int
tract: all characters numeric; replaced as long
blkg: all characters numeric; replaced as byte
blkg_lat: all characters numeric; replaced as double
blkg_lon: all characters numeric; replaced as double

. order state county tract blkg gisjoin blkg_lat blkg_lon blkg_area

. keep state county tract blkg gisjoin blkg_lat blkg_lon blkg_area

. save ../../data/processed/controls_blockg_2012, replace
(file ../../data/processed/controls_blockg_2012.dta not found)
file ../../data/processed/controls_blockg_2012.dta saved

. 
. ** add geographic characteristics
. foreach yy in 2000 2012 {
  2.         * read python gis output
.         import delimited ../../data/intermediate/controls_geo_blockg_`yy'.csv
> , clear
  3.         keep gisjoin by_coastline by_greatlakes by_majorrivers mean_rug_in
> t
  4.         rename by_coastline by_coast
  5.         rename by_majorrivers by_river
  6.         rename mean_rug_int tri
  7.         save `tmp', replace
  8.         use ../../data/processed/controls_blockg_`yy', clear
  9.         * drop puerto rico, hawaii, alaska
.         drop if state == 72
 10.         drop if state == 15
 11.         drop if state == 2
 12.         * merge with shapefile
.         merge 1:1 gisjoin using `tmp'
 13.         drop _merge
 14.         drop gisjoin
 15.         * combine lakeshore and coast
.         replace by_coast = 1 if by_greatlakes == 1
 16.         drop by_greatlakes
 17.         * add msa code, keep only block groups within an msa
.         merge m:1 state county using ../../data/processed/county2msa1999, kee
> pusing(msa msa_name)
 18.         keep if _merge == 3
 19.         drop _merge
 20.         preserve
 21.         * read college_town indicator
.         use ../../data/processed/controls_collegetown, clear
 22.         * add to each county in an msa
.         merge 1:m msa using ../../data/processed/county2msa1999
 23.         keep state county county_name msa_name msa college_town
 24.         save `tmp', replace
 25.         * merge by county
.         restore
 26.         merge m:1 state county using `tmp'
 27.         drop _merge
 28.         drop county_name
 29.         preserve
 30.         * read lat and lon for each city centre
.         use ../../data/processed/controls_citycentre, clear
 31.         * add to each county in an msa
.         merge 1:m msa using ../../data/processed/county2msa1999
 32.         keep state county county_name msa_name msa msa_lat msa_lon msa_mai
> ncity
 33.         save `tmp', replace
 34.         * merge by county
.         restore
 35.         merge m:1 state county using `tmp'
 36.         drop _merge
 37.         drop county_name
 38.         * calculate distance from each block group to msa center
.         gen dlon = (blkg_lon - msa_lon)*(_pi/180)
 39.         gen dlat = (blkg_lat - msa_lat)*(_pi/180)
 40.         gen a = (sin(dlat/2))^2 + cos(msa_lat*_pi/180) * cos(blkg_lat*_pi/
> 180) * (sin(dlon/2))^2
 41.         gen c = 2 * atan2(sqrt(a), sqrt(1-a))
 42.         gen dist2cbd = c * 6373 //Radius (R) of the Earth ~ 3961 miles or 
> 6373 km
 43.         drop dlon dlat a c
 44.         * school performance indicator: the relative ranking with respect 
> to mean proficiency or passing rates on standardized tests (averaged across m
> ath and reading)
.         gen double tract_id10 = (1000*state + county)*1000000 + tract
 45.         merge m:1 tract_id10 using ../../data/src/schools/schools_indicato
> rs_bytract, keepusing(tract_rkprofi)
 46.         drop if _merge == 2
 47.         drop _merge tract_id10
 48.         rename tract_rkprofi school_rank
 49.         * label and save
.         order state county tract blkg msa msa_name msa_maincity msa_lat msa_l
> on college_town blkg_lat blkg_lon blkg_area dist2cbd by_coast by_river tri sc
> hool_rank
 50.         label var state "State code"
 51.         label var county "County code"
 52.         label var tract "Census Tract code"
 53.         label var blkg "Census Block Group code"
 54.         label var blkg_lat "Census Block Group latitude"
 55.         label var blkg_lon "Census Block Group longitude"
 56.         label var blkg_area "Census Block Group land area (square metres)"
 57.         label variable dist2cbd "Distance to city centre (km)"
 58.         label var by_coast "By the coast or Great Lakes"
 59.         label var by_river "By the riverside"
 60.         label var tri "Terrain Ruggedness Index"
 61.         label var school_rank "Local school performance in standardised te
> sts relative to metro area"
 62.         label data "'Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton
>  & Puga. BG Controls 2000"
 63.         compress
 64.         sort state county tract blkg
 65.         save ../../data/processed/controls_blockg_`yy', replace
 66.         describe, fullnames
 67. }
(9 vars, 207,493 obs)

. ** ACS
. do housing_acs

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
> housing_acs.do
> 
> Stata do file to construct housing data for
> 'Urban growth and its aggregate implications',
> by Gilles Duranton and Diego Puga
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
. 
. * initialise
. clear

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. 
. tempfile tmp

. 
. ** convert downloaded acs data to usable stata format
. cd ../../data/src/acs/blockg
/home/urban/hcgrowth/empirics/data/src/acs/blockg

. do nhgis0030_ds191_20125_blck_grp.do

. * NOTE: You need to set the Stata working directory to the path
. * where the data file is located.

.

. cd ../../../../code/builddata
/home/urban/hcgrowth/empirics/code/builddata

. * drop empty variables
. foreach var of varlist _all {
  2.         capture assert missing(`var')
  3.         if !_rc {
  4.                 drop `var'
  5.         }
  6. }

. * drop margins of error
. drop name_m-qz6m001

. 
. ** block-group identifiers
. destring statea countya tracta blkgrpa, replace
statea: all characters numeric; replaced as byte
countya: all characters numeric; replaced as int
tracta: all characters numeric; replaced as long
blkgrpa: all characters numeric; replaced as byte

. rename state state_name

. rename county county_name

. rename statea state

. rename countya county

. rename tracta tract

. rename blkgrpa blkg

. rename name_e blkg_name

. label var state "State code"

. label var state_name "State name"

. label var county "County code"

. label var county_name "County name"

. label var tract "Census Tract code"

. label var blkg "Census Block Group code"

. label var blkg_name "Block Group name"

. * drop puerto rico, hawaii, alaska;
. drop if state == 72
(2,594 observations deleted)

. drop if state == 15
(875 observations deleted)

. drop if state == 2
(534 observations deleted)

. * keep only blocks within an msa
. gen fips = state*1000 + county

. merge m:1 fips using ../../data/processed/county2msa1999, keepusing(msa)
(variable fips was float, now double to accommodate using data's values)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                        46,774
        from master                    46,774  (_merge==1)
        from using                          0  (_merge==2)

    Matched                           169,556  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. keep if _merge == 3
(46,774 observations deleted)

. drop _merge msa fips

. 
. ** housing variables
. * total housing units
. rename qx6e001 hunits

. label var hunits "Housing units"

. * percentages by units in structure
. rename qyye001 structure_hunits

. gen pc_structure_1detached = 100*(qyye002 / structure_hunits)
(1,127 missing values generated)

. gen pc_structure_1attached = 100*(qyye003 / structure_hunits)
(1,127 missing values generated)

. gen pc_structure_2 = 100*(qyye004 / structure_hunits)
(1,127 missing values generated)

. gen pc_structure_3_4 = 100*(qyye005 / structure_hunits)
(1,127 missing values generated)

. gen pc_structure_5_9 = 100*(qyye006 / structure_hunits)
(1,127 missing values generated)

. gen pc_structure_10_19 = 100*(qyye007 / structure_hunits)
(1,127 missing values generated)

. gen pc_structure_20_49 = 100*(qyye008 / structure_hunits)
(1,127 missing values generated)

. gen pc_structure_over50 = 100*(qyye009 / structure_hunits)
(1,127 missing values generated)

. gen pc_structure_mobile = 100*(qyye010 / structure_hunits)
(1,127 missing values generated)

. gen pc_structure_other = 100*(qyye011 / structure_hunits)
(1,127 missing values generated)

. label var pc_structure_1detached "% housing units in structure with 1 unit, d
> etached"

. label var pc_structure_1attached "% housing units in structure with 1 unit, a
> ttached"

. label var pc_structure_10_19 "% housing units in structure with 10 to 19 unit
> s"

. label var pc_structure_20_49 "% housing units in structure with 20 to 49 unit
> s"

. label var pc_structure_over50 "% housing units in structure with 50 or more u
> nits"

. label var pc_structure_mobile "% housing units in mobile home"

. label var pc_structure_other "% housing units in boat, RV, van, etc."

. drop structure_hunits qyye0*

. * percentages by year built
. rename qy1e001 yearbuilt_hunits

. gen pc_yearbuilt_2010_later = 100*(qy1e002 / yearbuilt_hunits)
(1,127 missing values generated)

(1,127 missing values generated)

. ** demographic variables

(788 missing values generated)

. 
. ** combine with controls
. merge 1:1 state county tract blkg using ../../data/processed/controls_blockg_
> 2012

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------

        from master                       358  (_merge==1)
        from using                          0  (_merge==2)

    Matched                           169,198  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. drop _merge

. 
. ** label and save data
. order state county tract blkg state_name county_name blkg_name msa msa_name m
> sa_maincity msa_lat msa_lon blkg_lat blkg_lon blkg_area dist2cbd college_town
>  /*
> */ population households hunits /*
> */ yearbuilt_median pc_yearbuilt_* pc_structure_* pc_bedrooms_* /*
> */ contractrent_median value_median /*
> */ pc_pop_* school_rank /*
> */ by_coast by_river tri

. keep state county tract blkg state_name county_name blkg_name msa msa_name ms
> a_maincity msa_lat msa_lon blkg_lat blkg_lon blkg_area dist2cbd college_town 
> /*
> */ population households hunits /*
> */ yearbuilt_median pc_yearbuilt_* pc_structure_* pc_bedrooms_* /*
> */ contractrent_median value_median /*
> */ pc_pop_* school_rank /*
> */ by_coast by_river tri

. label data "'Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. AC
> S Block Group"

. compress
  variable population was double now long
  variable households was double now int
  variable hunits was double now int
  variable yearbuilt_median was double now int
  variable contractrent_median was double now int
  variable value_median was double now long
  variable state_name was str24 now str20
  variable county_name was str57 now str27
  variable blkg_name was str1000 now str77
  (167,690,884 bytes saved)

. sort state county tract blkg

. save ../../data/processed/housing_blockg_acs, replace
(file ../../data/processed/housing_blockg_acs.dta not found)
file ../../data/processed/housing_blockg_acs.dta saved

. describe, fullnames

                                                fringe (2012 $/ha)

     Note: Dataset has changed since last saved.

. save ../../data/processed/housing_msa, replace
(file ../../data/processed/housing_msa.dta not found)
file ../../data/processed/housing_msa.dta saved

. 
. *** rsmeans construction costs data
. * get city names and states for each msa
. use ../../data/processed/county2msa1999, clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. City Definition
> s )

. keep msa msa_name

. duplicates drop

Duplicates in terms of all variables

(571 observations deleted)

. split msa_name, parse(,)
variables created as string: 
msa_name1  msa_name2  msa_name3

. rename msa_name1 city

. replace city =  ustrlower(city)
(275 real changes made)

. split city, parse(-)
variables created as string: 
city1  city2  city3  city4  city5  city6

. replace msa_name2 =  usubinstr(msa_name2," MSA","",1)
(245 real changes made)

. replace msa_name2 =  usubinstr(msa_name2," CMSA","",1)
(17 real changes made)

. replace msa_name2 =  usubinstr(msa_name2," NECMA","",1)
(12 real changes made)

. rename msa_name2 state

. split state, parse(-)
variables created as string: 
state1  state2  state3  state4

. replace state2 = "AR" if state2 == "Texarkana"
(1 real change made)

. drop city state msa_name3

. save `tmp', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. * prepare rsmeans city names
. use ../../data/src/rsmeans/rsmeans_2015.dta

. gen ones = 1

. collapse (sum) ones, by(city state)

. drop ones

. drop if state == "AK" | state == "HI"
(2 observations deleted)

. replace state = "TN" if city == "chattanooga" & state == "SD"
(1 real change made)

. * prepare first-pass crosswalk with msa name
. preserve

. keep if city == "national"
(197 observations deleted)

. gen msa = .
(1 missing value generated)

. save `xwalk', replace
(file /tmp/St10336.000003 not found)
file /tmp/St10336.000003 saved as .dta format

. * get full rsmeans again
. restore

. * loop through city names
. forvalues i = 1(1)6 {
  2.         * loop through states
.         forvalues s = 1(1)4 {
  3.                 preserve
  4.                 * drop already matched
.                 merge m:m city state using `xwalk'
  5.                 drop if _merge == 3
  6.                 keep city state
  7.                 * city name for matching
.                 gen city`i' = city
  8.                 * state for matching
.                 gen state`s' = state
  9.                 * match on city, state
.                 merge m:m city`i' state`s' using `tmp'
 10.                 * add new matches to crosswalk
.                 keep if _merge == 3
 11.                 drop _merge
 12.                 keep msa msa_name city state
 13.                 append using `xwalk'
 14.                 save `xwalk', replace
 15.                 * get full rsmeans again
.                 restore
 16.         }
 17. }

        nonmissing conflict                 0  (_merge==5)
    -----------------------------------------

. keep if _merge == 3
(38 observations deleted)

. collapse (mean) wrluri [fw=pop2010], by(msa msa_name)

. count if !missing(wrluri)
  237

. rename wrluri wrluri2006

. * label and save data
. label var msa "MSA/NECMA FIPS code (1999 definitions)"

. label var msa_name "MSA/NECMA name"

. label var wrluri2006 "Wharton Residential Land Use Regulatory Index 2006"

. 
. *** residential construction permits
. 
. * the permits data is pulled from http://socds.huduser.gov/permits/
. * geography: states and counties, periodicity: annual
. * select state, select all the counties belong to the state, check county tot
> al, select all years and all series; the data is pulled by state
. * FIPS.txt downloaded from https://www2.census.gov/geo/docs/reference/codes/f
> iles/national_county.txt
. * read and process excel files
. local unitlist = "units_1 units_2 units_3to4 units_5plus units_total"

. local input: dir "../../data/src/permits" files "*.xlsx"

. dis `input'
VT.xlsxMN.xlsxTN.xlsxNM.xlsxKY.xlsxMI.xlsxWV.xlsxGA.xlsxWA.xlsxIN.xlsxVA.xlsxDC
> .xlsxMT.xlsxTX.xlsxWY.xlsxSC.xlsxRI.xlsxSD.xlsxID.xlsxME.xlsxCO.xlsxNJ.xlsxLA
> .xlsxOK.xlsxNE.xlsxND.xlsxOH.xlsxOR.xlsxNV.xlsxKS.xlsxMA.xlsxWI.xlsxAZ.xlsxNC
> .xlsxHI.xlsxUT.xlsxNY.xlsxAR.xlsxDE.xlsxFL.xlsxNH.xlsxMD.xlsxIA.xlsxMS.xlsxMO
> .xlsxAL.xlsxPA.xlsxAK.xlsxIL.xlsxCA.xlsxCT.xlsx

. local state "NM"

. foreach state in `input'{
  2.         * import by state
.         local st = upper(subinstr("`state'",".xlsx","",.))
  3.         display "processing permit data for state `st'"
  4.         import excel "../../data/src/permits/`st'.xlsx", clear
  5.         * get the year names
.         foreach var of varlist * {
  6.                 if "`var'" != "A" {
  7.                         local tempname = `var'[11]
  8.                         disp
  9.                         rename (`var') (year`tempname')
 10.                 }
 11.         }
 12.         * detect data rows
.         gen first = regexm(A ,"County")
 13.         gen data = regexm(A, "Structures")
 14.         gen unit = regexm(A, "units")
 15.         gen unit2 = regexm(A, "Units")
 16.         gen census = regexm(A, "Census Area") //AK specific
 17.         gen Borough = regexm(A, "Borough") //AK specific
 18.         gen wranglell = regexm(A, "Wrangell,AK") //AK specific
 19.         gen muni = regexm(A, "Municipality")  //AK specific
 20.         gen DC = regexm(A, "District of Columbia") //DC specific
 21.         gen parish = regexm(A, "Parish") //LA specific
 22.         gen city = regexm(A,"city") //Baltimore city specific
 23.         gen city2 = regexm(A, "City")
 24.         keep if first == 1 | data == 1 | unit == 1 | unit2 == 1 | census =
> = 1 | Borough == 1 | wranglell == 1 | DC == 1| muni == 1 | parish == 1| city 
> == 1 | city2 == 1
 25.         drop if A == "County Totals"
 26.         drop first data unit unit2 census DC muni Borough wranglell parish
>  city city2
 27.         gen id = _n
 28.         qui sum id
 29.         local end = r(max)
 30.         dis `end'
 31.         gen countyname = ""
 32.         forval j = 1(7)`end' {
 33.                 dis `j'
 34.                 local idmin = `j'
 35.                 local idmax = `j' + 7
 36.                 replace countyname = A[`j'] if id >= `idmin' & id <= `idma
> x'
 37.         }
 38.         drop id
 39.         drop if A == countyname
 40.         * units identifiers
.         gen units_1 = 1 if A == "Units in Single-Family Structures"
 41.         gen units_2 = 1 if A == "Units in 2-unit Multi-Family Structures"
 42.         gen units_3to4 = 1 if A == "Units in 3- and 4-unit Multi-Family St
> ructures"
 43.         gen units_5plus = 1 if A == "Units in 5+ Unit Multi-Family Structu
> res"
 44.         gen units_total = 1 if A == "Total Units"
 45.         save `tmp', replace
 46.         * get the units specific dataset
.         foreach unit in `unitlist' {
 47.                 use `tmp', clear
 48.                 keep if `unit' == 1
 49.                 drop units*
 50.                 reshape long year@, i(A countyname) j (y, string)
 51.                 rename (year) (`unit')
 52.                 drop A
 53.                 save "../../data/processed/`unit'permits`st'.dta", replace
 54.         }
 55.         * merge all units together
.         use "../../data/processed/units_1permits`st'.dta", replace
 56.         local mergelist "units_2 units_3to4 units_5plus units_total"
 57.         foreach m in `mergelist' {
 58.                 merge 1:1 y countyname using "../../data/processed/`m'perm
> its`st'.dta"
 59.                 drop _merge
 60.                 erase "../../data/processed/`m'permits`st'.dta"
 61.         }
 62.         erase "../../data/processed/units_1permits`st'.dta"
 63.         save "../../data/processed/permits`st'.dta", replace
 64. }
processing permit data for state VT
(42 vars, 147 obs)

. * append state level data together
. local stinput: dir "../../data/processed" files "permits*.dta"

. dis `stinput'
permitsMD.dtapermitsOR.dtapermitsMN.dtapermitsGA.dtapermitsKY.dtapermitsVT.dtap
> ermitsKS.dtapermitsMI.dtapermitsNJ.dtapermitsWA.dtapermitsNY.dtapermitsHI.dta
> permitsDE.dtapermitsIA.dtapermitsWY.dtapermitsTN.dtapermitsAR.dtapermitsOK.dt
> apermitsOH.dtapermitsSD.dtapermitsNE.dtapermitsME.dtapermitsIN.dtapermitsVA.d
> tapermitsAK.dtapermitsNV.dtapermitsAZ.dtapermitsWV.dtapermitsCO.dtapermitsTX.
> dtapermitsPA.dtapermitsIL.dtapermitsAL.dtapermitsCA.dtapermitsMO.dtapermitsNC
> .dtapermitsFL.dtapermitsMT.dtapermitsWI.dtapermitsND.dtapermitsMA.dtapermitsD
> C.dtapermitsLA.dtapermitsUT.dtapermitsSC.dtapermitsID.dtapermitsMS.dtapermits
> NH.dtapermitsRI.dtapermitsCT.dtapermitsNM.dta

. local i = 0

. foreach s in `stinput' {
  2.         use "../../data/processed/`s'", clear
  3.         erase "../../data/processed/`s'"
  4.         if `i' > 0 {
  5.                 append using `tmpcounty'
  6.         }
  7.         cap duplicates drop
  8.         save `tmpcounty', replace
  9.         local i = `i' + 1
 10. }

. * assign fips code to county
. insheet using ../../data/src/permits/FIPS.txt, clear
(5 vars, 3,235 obs)

. rename v2 statecode

. rename v3 countycode

. rename v1 state

. rename v4 county

. keep state* county*

. save `tmp', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. use `tmpcounty', clear

. rename y year

. destring year, replace
year: all characters numeric; replaced as int

. gen state = substr(countyname,-2,2)

. gen length = strlen(countyname) - 5

. gen county = substr(countyname,1,length)

. drop length

. replace county = "Wrangell City and Borough" if regexm(county, "Wrangell-Pete
> rsburg Census Area") & state == "AK"
(41 real changes made)

. replace county = "Prince of Wales-Hyder Census Area" if regexm(county, "Princ
> e of Wales-Outer Ketchikan Census Area") & state == "AK"
(41 real changes made)

. replace county = "Skagway Municipality" if regexm(county, "Skagway-Hoonah-Ang
> oon Census Area") & state == "AK"
(41 real changes made)

. replace county = "LaSalle County" if regexm(county, "La Salle County") & stat
> e == "IL"
(41 real changes made)

. replace county = "Prince George's County" if regexm(county, "Prince Georges C
> ounty") & state == "MD"
(41 real changes made)

. replace county = "Queen Anne's County" if regexm(county, "Queen Annes County"
> ) & state == "MD"
(41 real changes made)

. merge m:1 county state using `tmp'

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                           786
        from master                       615  (_merge==1)
        from using                        171  (_merge==2)

    Matched                           125,624  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. keep if _merge == 3
(786 observations deleted)

. drop _merge

. * aggregate by msa
. rename county county_name2

. rename countycode county

. rename state state_name

. rename statecode state

. merge m:1 state county using ../../data/processed/county2msa1999, keepusing(m
> sa county_name msa_name)

. gen pc_pop_hispanic = 100*(pop_hispanic / race_pop)
(867 missing values generated)

. gen pc_pop_black = 100*(har002 / race_pop)
(867 missing values generated)

. gen pc_pop_asian = 100*(har004 / race_pop)
(867 missing values generated)

. *** nhts 2009 household data
. 
. ** read nhts vehicle data
. import delimited ../../data/src/nhts/VEHV2PUB.CSV, clear
(61 vars, 309,163 obs)

. * vmt
. keep houseid annmiles bestmile od_read

. collapse (sum) annmiles bestmile, by(houseid)

. rename bestmile hh_vmt_bestmile

. label var hh_vmt_bestmile "Best estimate of household annual miles"

. rename annmiles hh_vmt_annmiles

. label var hh_vmt_annmiles "Self-reported annualized household mile estimate"

. save `tmphh', replace
(file /tmp/St10336.000002 not found)
file /tmp/St10336.000002 saved as .dta format

. 
. ** read nhts person data
. import delimited ../../data/src/nhts/PERV2PUB.CSV, clear
(117 vars, 308,901 obs)

. sort houseid

. * average distance to work (converted to km.)
. replace disttowk = . if disttowk < 0
(190,212 real changes made, 190,212 to missing)

. replace disttowk = disttowk * 1.60934
(117,647 real changes made)

. gen disttowk_nm = 0

. replace disttowk_nm = 1 if !missing(disttowk)
(118,689 real changes made)

. by houseid: egen hh_disttowk_s = total(disttowk)

. by houseid: egen hh_disttowk_n = total(disttowk_nm)

. by houseid: gen hh_disttowk = hh_disttowk_s / hh_disttowk_n
(109,884 missing values generated)

. * male share of drivers
. recode r_sex 2=0
(165,764 changes made to r_sex)

. replace driver = 0 if driver < 0
(34,429 real changes made)

. recode driver 2=0
(24,590 changes made to driver)

. replace r_sex = 0 if driver == 0
(26,294 real changes made)

. by houseid: egen hh_maled = total(r_sex)

. by houseid: egen hh_drivers = total(driver)

. by houseid: gen hh_male_sh = hh_maled / hh_drivers
(7,283 missing values generated)

. collapse (mean) hh_disttowk hh_male_sh (max) educ, by(houseid)

. label var hh_disttowk "Distance to work (km., household average)"

. label var hh_male_sh "Share household drivers who are male"

. gen hh_educ_college = 0

. replace hh_educ_college = 1 if educ >= 4
(67,408 real changes made)

. label var hh_educ_college "At least one college graduate in household"

. gen hh_educ_dropout = 0

. replace hh_educ_dropout = 1 if educ == 1
(8,203 real changes made)

. label var hh_educ_dropout "No-one completed highschool in household"

. drop educ

. merge 1:1 houseid using `tmphh'

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                         7,063
        from master                     7,063  (_merge==1)
        from using                          0  (_merge==2)

    Matched                           143,084  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. keep if _merge == 3
(7,063 observations deleted)

. drop _merge

. save `tmphh', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000002 saved as .dta format

. * users without access to data on the residence block group
. * of households in nhts 2009 that wish to check
. * that the replication code runs smoothly can set
. * global NHTSGenerateFakeLocations = 1 in _hcgrowth_run.do;
. * this will randomly generate a fake location for each household
. * that will allow the code to run but generate meaningless results with
. * the same format but different values than the actual results in the article
. else if ("$NHTSGenerateFakeLocations" == "1") {
.         use ../../data/processed/controls_blockg_2000, clear
.         keep state county tract blkg msa
.         generate rndu = runiform()
.         sort msa rndu
.         by msa: generate rndorder = _n
.         keep msa rndorder state county tract blkg
.         save `tmp', replace
.         use ../../data/intermediate/nhts_msa, clear
.         sort msa houseid
.         by msa: generate rndorder = _n
.         merge 1:1 msa rndorder using `tmp'
.         keep if _merge == 3
.         drop _merge
.         keep houseid state county tract blkg
. }

.
