.         do travel_nhts_trip

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
> travel_nhts_trip.do
> 
> Stata do file to process NHTS 2009 trip data for
> 'Urban growth and its aggregate implications',
> by Gilles Duranton and Diego Puga
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
. 
. * initialise
. clear

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. 
. tempfile tmp

. 
. ** read nhts trip data
. import delimited ../../data/src/nhts/DAYV2PUB.CSV, clear
(112 vars, 1,167,321 obs)

. keep houseid personid trpmiles trptrans vehtype trphhveh travday tdaydate drv
> r_flg trvl_min whytrp90 tdwknd wttrdfin travday tdaydate strttime

. * match households to msa, keep only trips for households in an msa
. merge m:1 houseid using ../../data/intermediate/nhts_msa, keepusing(msa)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                       236,633
        from master                   226,066  (_merge==1)
        from using                     10,567  (_merge==2)

    Matched                           941,255  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. drop if missing(msa)
(226,066 observations deleted)

. keep if _merge == 3
(10,567 observations deleted)

. drop _merge

. * drop every person who enters an unusable transportation mode in any trip (i
> .e. trptrans -1 -7 -8 -9)
. gen x = 0

. replace x = 1 if trptrans == -1 | trptrans == -7 | trptrans == -8 | trptrans 
> == -9
(1,679 real changes made)

. by houseid personid, sort: egen y = sum(x)

. drop if y > 0
(2,906 observations deleted)

. drop y x

. * drop every person who enters a not ascertained response in any trip for whe
> ther they were the driver  (i.e. drvr_flg -9)
. gen x = 0

. replace x = 1 if drvr_flg == -9
(45,759 real changes made)

. by houseid personid, sort: egen y = sum(x)

. drop if y > 0
(93,888 observations deleted)

. drop y x

. * keep only trips where respondent was the driver (drvr_flg, avoids double-co
> unting) by (trptrans): 1) car, 2) van, 3) suv, 4) pick-up
. keep if ((trptrans==1 | trptrans==2 | trptrans==3 | trptrans==4) & drvr_flg =
> = 1)
(273,814 observations deleted)

. drop trptrans drvr_flg

. * additional clean-up (not in trip_vmt_09_revised.do): keep only trips in hou
> sehold vehicle (trphhveh 1) where this vehicle is (vehtype):  1) car, 2) van,
>  3) suv, 4) pick-up
. keep if ((vehtype==1 | vehtype==2 | vehtype==3 | vehtype==4) & trphhveh == 1)
(9,660 observations deleted)

. drop vehtype trphhveh

. * calculate trip speed in mph
. gen mph_trip = trpmiles/(trvl_min/60)
(6 missing values generated)

. * drop every person who reports a trip with the 0.5% highest/lowest values fo
> r speed, distance and time (or with unreported distance and time)
. gen x = 0

. replace x = 1 if trvl_min <= 0 | trpmiles <= 0
(5,977 real changes made)

. _pctile trpmiles if x == 0, percentile(0.5, 99.5)

. scalar dist05 = r(r1)

. scalar dist995 = r(r2)

. _pctile trvl_min if x == 0, percentile(0.5, 99.5)

. scalar time05 = r(r1)

. scalar time995 = r(r2)

. _pctile mph_trip if x == 0, percentile(0.5, 99.5)

. scalar mph05 = r(r1)

. scalar mph995 = r(r2)

. display dist05, dist995, time05, time995, mph05, mph995
.11111111 108 1 130 1.3333334 75.789474

. replace x = 1 if trpmiles < dist05 | trpmiles > dist995
(2,765 real changes made)

. replace x = 1 if trvl_min < time05 | trvl_min > time995
(527 real changes made)

. replace x = 1 if mph_trip < mph05 | mph_trip > mph995
(3,625 real changes made)

. by houseid personid, sort: egen y = sum(x)

. drop if y > 0
(36,527 observations deleted)

. drop y x

.

. gen x = 1

  2,623

. drop if x < 3

strttime already numeric; no replace

. gen peak = 0

. replace peak = 1 if (((strttime >= 0600  & strttime < 1000) | (strttime >= 15
> 00 & strttime < 1900)) & tdwknd == 0)
(207,103 real changes made)

. label var peak "Trip during peak hours (weekdays 6-10am, 3-7pm)"

. 
. ** select, rename and label variables
. drop trip_purpose_* wttrdfin

. gen trip_km = trpmiles * 1.60934

. label var trip_km "Trip distance (km)"

. drop trpmiles

. rename trvl_min trip_min

. label var trip_min "Trip duration (minutes)"

. gen trip_kph = trip_km/(trip_min/60)

. label var trip_kph "Trip speed (km/h)"

. drop mph_trip

. label var strttime "Trip begin time in military format"

. label var whytrp90 "Trip purpose"

. label var tdaydate "Year and month of the household's travel day"

. label var travday "Day of the week of the household's travel day"

. label var tdwknd "Trip was on weekend (Friday 6pm - Sunday midnight)"

. order tdaydate strttime travday tdwknd peak

. save `tmp', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. 
. ** read nhts person data
. import delimited ../../data/src/nhts/PERV2PUB.CSV, clear
(117 vars, 308,901 obs)

. * keep only drivers
. keep if driver == 1
(59,019 observations deleted)

. * age and gender
. rename r_age age

. label var age "Driver age"

. recode r_sex 2=0
(133,039 changes made to r_sex)

. rename r_sex male

. label var male "Driver gender male"

. * us born
. replace borninus = . if borninus < 0
(1,177 real changes made, 1,177 to missing)

. recode borninus 2=0
(22,168 changes made to borninus)

. label var borninus "Born in USA"

. * education
. replace educ = . if educ < 0
(7,567 real changes made, 7,567 to missing)

. gen byte educ_dropout = educ==1 if !missing(educ)
(7,567 missing values generated)

. gen byte educ_hschool = educ==2 if !missing(educ)
(7,567 missing values generated)

. gen byte educ_somecol = educ==3 if !missing(educ)
(7,567 missing values generated)

. gen byte educ_college = educ==4 if !missing(educ)
(7,567 missing values generated)

. gen byte educ_postgrad = educ==5 if !missing(educ)
(7,567 missing values generated)

. label var educ_dropout "High-school dropout"

. label var educ_hschool "High-school graduate"

. label var educ_somecol "Some college"

. label var educ_college "College graduate"

. label var educ_postgrad "Postgraduate"

. drop educ

. * worker
. replace worker = . if worker < 0
(1,143 real changes made, 1,143 to missing)

. recode worker 2=0
(112,570 changes made to worker)

. label var worker "Worker"

. * distance to work (converted to km.)
. replace disttowk = . if disttowk < 0
(133,363 real changes made, 133,363 to missing)

. replace disttowk = disttowk * 1.60934
(115,513 real changes made)

. rename disttowk dist2work

. label var dist2work "Distance to work (km)"

. order houseid personid age male borninus educ* worker dist2work

. keep houseid personid age male borninus educ* worker dist2work

. 
. ** combine trip, person and household data
. merge 1:m houseid personid using `tmp'

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                       122,043
        from master                   122,038  (_merge==1)
        from using                          5  (_merge==2)

    Matched                           524,053  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. keep if _merge == 3
(122,043 observations deleted)

. drop _merge

. merge m:1 houseid using ../../data/processed/travel_nhts_hh

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                        23,886
        from master                         0  (_merge==1)
        from using                     23,886  (_merge==2)

    Matched                           524,053  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. keep if _merge == 3
(23,886 observations deleted)

. drop _merge

. drop state county tract blkg

. label var bg_population "Block-group population"

. label var bg_households "Block-group households"

. label var bg_pc_pop_hispanic "Block-group % Hispanic population"

. label var bg_pc_pop_black "Block-group % Black population"

. label var bg_pc_pop_asian "Block-group % Asian population"

. label var bg_by_coast  "Block-group by the coast or lakeshore"

. label var bg_by_river "Block-group by the riverside"

. label var bg_tri "Block-group Terrain Ruggedness Index"

. order msa msa_name msa_maincity college_town houseid personid hh_* dist2cbd d
> ist2work bg_* trip_*

. label data "'Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. NH
> TS trip"

. compress
  variable peak was float now byte
  (1,572,159 bytes saved)

. sort houseid personid

. save ../../data/processed/travel_nhts_trip, replace
(file ../../data/processed/travel_nhts_trip.dta not found)
file ../../data/processed/travel_nhts_trip.dta saved

. describe, fullnames

. }

. erase ../../data/processed/controls_blockg_2000.dta

. 
. ** NLSY79
. do nlsy_panel

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
> nlsy_panel.do
> 
> Stata do file used to recreate the NLSY79 panel for
> 'City of dreams',
> by Jorge De la Roca, Gianmarco Ottaviano and Diego Puga,
> Journal of the European Economic Association
> 
> Constructs NLSY79 panel from source files
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
. 
. * initialise
. clear

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. 
. * define tempfiles
. tempfile tmp

. tempfile tmp_fips

. tempfile tmp_panel

.

. 
. ** demographics
. rename (R0000100 R0173600 R0214700 R0214800) (person_id sample_type race sex)

. replace sex = 0 if sex == 2
(6,283 real changes made)

. gen birth_year = 1900 + R0410300 if R0410300 > 0
(491 missing values generated)

. replace birth_year = 1900 + R0000500 if missing(birth_year)
(491 real changes made)

. gen birth_month = R0410100 if R0410100 > 0
(491 missing values generated)

. replace birth_month = R0000300 if missing(birth_month)
(491 real changes made)

. keep if sample_type <= 8
(6,575 observations deleted)

.

. /* To convert variable names to lower case use the TOLOWER command 
>  *      (type findit tolower and follow the links to install).
>  * TOLOWER VARLIST will change listed variables to lower case; 
>  *  TOLOWER without a specified variable list will convert all variables in t
> he dataset to lower case
>  */
. /* tolower */
. 
end of do-file
.         * fips code: state and county of residence at birth
.         replace R0001000 = . if R0001000 <= 0
(935 real changes made, 935 to missing)
.         replace R0001000 = 100 + R0001000
(11,751 real changes made)
.         gen state = string(R0001000)
.         gen state_birth = substr(state,2,2)
(935 missing values generated)
.         replace R0000900 = . if R0000900 <= 0
(1,240 real changes made, 1,240 to missing)
.         replace R0000900 = 1000 + R0000900
(11,446 real changes made)
.         gen county = string(R0000900)
.         gen county_birth = substr(county,2,3)
(1,240 missing values generated)
.         gen fips_birth = state_birth + county_birth
(927 missing values generated)
.         gen fips_birth_raw = fips_birth
(927 missing values generated)
.         gen length = length(fips_birth) if fips_birth != ""
(927 missing values generated)
.         replace fips_birth = "" if length < 5
(321 real changes made)
.         replace fips_birth_raw = "" if length == 3
(8 real changes made)
.         drop state county length
.         * fips code: state and county of residence at 14
.         replace R0001600 = . if R0001600 <= 0
(393 real changes made, 393 to missing)
.         replace R0001600 = 100 + R0001600
(12,293 real changes made)
.         gen state = string(R0001600)
.         gen state_at14 = substr(state,2,2)
(393 missing values generated)
.         replace R0001500 = . if R0001500 <= 0
(556 real changes made, 556 to missing)
.         replace R0001500 = 1000 + R0001500
(12,130 real changes made)
.         gen county = string(R0001500)
.         gen county_at14 = substr(county,2,3)
(556 missing values generated)
.         gen fips_at14 = state_at14 + county_at14
(391 missing values generated)
.         gen fips_at14_raw = fips_at14
(391 missing values generated)
.         gen length = length(fips_at14) if fips_at14 != ""
(391 missing values generated)
.         replace fips_at14 = "" if length < 5
(167 real changes made)
.         replace fips_at14_raw = "" if length == 3
(2 real changes made)
.         keep R0000100 fips_birth fips_at14
.         rename R0000100 person_id
.         save `tmp', replace
(file /tmp/St10336.000001 not found)
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format
.         restore
.         merge 1:1 person_id using `tmp', keep(match) nogen

. ** adjust nominal values for inflation (cpi 1982-1984 = 100)
. * source: https://data.bls.gov/timeseries/CUSR0000SA0
. preserve

. import excel ../../data/src/nlsy/cpi_ind_occ/cpi_sa_1947_2015.xlsx, cellrange

. * adjust wages for inflation
. * wages are in cents of dollars, cpi 1982-1984 = 100
. * dividing by cpi converts nominal cents into real dollars
. replace wage = wage / cpi
(106,736 real changes made)

. * code as missings wages that exceed 250 dollars per hour
. replace wage = . if wage > 250
(74 real changes made, 74 to missing)

. drop cpi

. 
. * users without access to the geocode nlsy79 data that wish to check
. * that the replication code runs smoothly can set
. * global NLSYGenerateFakeLocations = 0 in _dreams_run.do;
. * this will randomly generate a fake location history for each respondent
. * that will allow the code to run but generate meaningless results with
. * the same format but different values than the actual results in the article
> ;
. * the fake location history will be created whenever "$NLSYDisableGeocode" ==
>  "1"
. * but only kept if "$NLSYGenerateFakeLocations" == "1"
. if ("$NLSYDisableGeocode" == "1") {
.         drop fips fips_
.         * possible values for fake fips codes are all in any cbsa
.         preserve
.         import excel "../../data/src/cbsa/CBSA_def2009.xls", cellrange(A5:L18
> 66) clear
.         rename K fips
.         keep fips
.         destring fips, replace
.         drop if missing(fips)
.         sort fips
.         gen fips_order = _n
.         count
.         local fips_n = `r(N)'
.         save `tmp_fips', replace
.         restore
.         * randomly assign one of the potential fips codes as fips_birth to ea
> ch individual
.         gen fips_order = runiformint(1,`fips_n')
.         sort person_id year
.         replace fips_order = fips_order[_n-1] if person_id == person_id[_n-1]
.         merge m:1 fips_order using `tmp_fips', nogen keep(match)
.         rename fips fips_birth
.         * keep fips_birth as fips_at14 for 61% of individuals, others get a r
> andom fips
.         gen fips_order2 = runiformint(1,`fips_n')
.         sort person_id year
.         replace fips_order2 = fips_order2[_n-1] if person_id == person_id[_n-
> 1]
.         gen rmigrant = runiform(0,100)
.         replace rmigrant = rmigrant > 61
.         sort person_id year
.         replace rmigrant = rmigrant[_n-1] if person_id == person_id[_n-1]
.         replace fips_order = fips_order2 if rmigrant == 1
.         merge m:1 fips_order using `tmp_fips', nogen keep(match)
.         rename fips fips_at14
.         drop fips_order2 rmigrant
.         * keep fips_at14 as fips in 1979 for 79.2% of individuals, others get
>  a random fips
.         gen fips_order2 = runiformint(1,`fips_n')
.         sort person_id year
.         replace fips_order2 = fips_order2[_n-1] if person_id == person_id[_n-
> 1]
.         gen rmigrant = runiform(0,100)
.         replace rmigrant = rmigrant > 79.2
.         sort person_id year
.         replace rmigrant = rmigrant[_n-1] if person_id == person_id[_n-1]
.         replace fips_order = fips_order2 if rmigrant == 1
.         merge m:1 fips_order using `tmp_fips', nogen keep(match)
.         rename fips fips_
.         drop fips_order2 rmigrant
.         * keep fips in 1979 as fips every year for 52.9% of individuals, othe
> rs get a random fips from a random year
.         gen fips_order2 = runiformint(1,`fips_n')
.         sort person_id year
.         replace fips_order2 = fips_order2[_n-1] if person_id == person_id[_n-
> 1]
.         gen rmigrant = runiform(0,100)
.         replace rmigrant = rmigrant > 52.9
.         sort person_id year
.         replace rmigrant = rmigrant[_n-1] if person_id == person_id[_n-1]
.         gen ryear = runiformint(1980,1996)
.         sort person_id year
.         replace ryear = ryear[_n-1] if person_id == person_id[_n-1]
.         replace fips_order = fips_order2 if rmigrant == 1 & year >= ryear
.         merge m:1 fips_order using `tmp_fips', nogen keep(match)
.         replace fips_ = fips
.         drop fips fips_order fips_order2 rmigrant ryear
.         sort person_id year
. }

. 
. ** fix county code changes and misclassifications
. rename fips_ fips

. 
. * county changes
. * based on David Dorn's county code changes
. * https://www.ddorn.net/data/FIPS_County_Code_Changes.pdf
. foreach var of varlist fips_birth fips_at14 fips {
  2.         * 1981: Cibola county, NM (FIPS 35006) is created out of parts of 
> Valencia county, NM (FIPS 35061)
.         replace `var' = 35061 if `var' == 35006
  3.         * 1981: La Paz county, AZ (FIPS 4012) is created out of parts of Y
> uma county, AZ (FIPS 4027)
.         replace `var' =  4027 if `var' ==  4012
  4.         * 1983: Washabaugh county, SD (FIPS 46131) merges into Jackson cou
> nty, SD (FIPS 46071)
.         replace `var' = 46071 if `var' == 46131
  5.         * 1995: The independent city of South Boston, VA (FIPS 51780) merg
> es into Halifax county, VA (FIPS 51083)
.         replace `var' = 51083 if `var' == 51780
  6.         * 1997: Yellowstone National Park territory, MT (FIPS 30113) is me
> rged into Gallantin, MT (FIPS 30031) and Park, MT (FIPS 30067) counties
.         replace `var' = 30031 if `var' == 30113
  7.         * 1997: Dade county, FL (FIPS 12025) is renamed as Miami-Dade coun
> ty, FL (FIPS 12086)
.         replace `var' = 12086 if `var' == 12025
  8.         * 2001: The independent city of Clifton Forge, VA (FIPS 51560) mer
> ges into Alleghany county, VA (FIPS 51005)
.         replace `var' = 51005 if `var' == 51560
  9.         * 2001: Broomfield county, CO (FIPS 8014) is created out of parts 
> of Adams, Boulder, Jefferson, and Weld counties
.         * Most of the population came from Boulder
.         replace `var' =  8013 if `var' ==  8014
 10.         * Post sample changes
.         * 2013: Bedford (independent) city, VA (FIPS 51515) was changed to to
> wn status and added to Bedford County (FIPS 51019)
.         * 2015: Shannon County, SD (FIPS 46113) is renamed to Oglala Lakota C
> ounty, SD (FIPS 46102)
. }
(0 real changes made)
(0 real changes made)
(0 real changes made)
(75 real changes made)
(0 real changes made)
(625 real changes made)
(0 real changes made)
(0 real changes made)

. 
. * Attachment 102: Federal Information Processing Standards Publication 5-1
. * https://www.nlsinfo.org/content/cohorts/nlsy79/other-documentation/geocode-
> codebook-supplement/attachment-102-state-fips
. * Ohio State University Center for Human Resource Research (CHRR)
. * Note from CHRR: In addition to the FIPS county codes, the following codes w
> ere used when the place name was not specific enough or the place name could 
> not be found
. foreach var of varlist fips_birth fips_at14 fips {
  2.         * Replace New York City, NY (36500) by Kings County, NY (36047), t
> he most populous county in NYC
.         replace `var' = 36047 if `var' == 36500
  3.         * Replace Long Island, NY (36600) by Suffolk County, NY (36103)
.         replace `var' = 36103 if `var' == 36600
  4.         * Replace Attica, NY (36300) by Wyoming County, NY (36121)
.         replace `var' = 36121 if `var' == 36300
  5.         * Replace Tulsa, OK (40400) by Tulsa County, OK (40143)
.         replace `var' = 40143 if `var' == 40400
  6.         * Replace Milwaukee, WI (55600) by Milwaukee County, WI (55079)
.         replace `var' = 55079 if `var' == 55600
  7.         * Replace Kansas City, MO (29700) by Jackson County, MO (29095)
.         replace `var' = 29095 if `var' == 29700
  8.         * Replace Richardson, TX (48701) by Dallas County, TX (48113)
.         replace `var' = 48113 if `var' == 48701
  9.         * Replace Amarillo, TX (48700) by Potter County, TX (48375)
.         replace `var' = 48113 if `var' == 48375
 10.         * Replace Pleasant Grove, TX (48701) by Dallas County, TX (48113)
.         replace `var' = 48113 if `var' == 48703
 11.         * Replace Huntington, WV (54200) by Cabell County, WV (54011)
.         replace `var' = 54011 if `var' == 54200
 12.         * Replace Cut Off, LA (22200) by Lafourche Parish, LA (22057)
.         replace `var' = 22057 if `var' == 22200
 13.         * Replace Salem, OR (41200) by Marion County, OR (41047)
.         replace `var' = 41047 if `var' == 41200
 14.         * Replace Laton Hill, AL (1200) by Washington County, AL (1129)
.         replace `var' = 1129 if `var' == 1200
 15. 
.         * Alaska Historical Codes (1979-2008)
.         * Fairbanks North Star Borough changed its code from 02818 to 02090
.         replace `var' = 2090 if `var' == 2818
 16.         * Barrow Division (02040) its part of North Slope Borough (02185)
.         replace `var' = 2185 if `var' == 2040
 17.         * Seward Division (02210) its part of Kenai Peninsula Borough (212
> 2)
.         replace `var' = 2122 if `var' == 2210
 18.         * Valdez-Chitina-Whittier Division (02260) its part of Valdez-Cord
> ova Census Area (02261)
.         replace `var' = 2261 if `var' == 2260
 19. }

. 
. ** sample restrictions
. * drop non-interview waves
. drop if non_int == 1
(18,499 observations deleted)

. 
. ** create cumulative variables
. * age
. gen age = year - birth_year

. * labor market experience
. sort person_id year

. by person_id: gen experience = sum(wkswk_li) if age >= 18
(4,541 missing values generated)

. * experience in big cities is calculated later as it depends on a partiuclar 
> city-size threshold
. * time in unemployment and out of the labor force
. by person_id: gen unemployment = sum(wksunem_li) if age >= 18
(4,541 missing values generated)

. by person_id: gen outlf = sum(wksolf_li) if age >= 18
(4,541 missing values generated)

. drop wksunem_li wksolf_li

. * express experience in years
. replace experience = experience / 52.18
(126,724 real changes made)

. * express tenure in years
. replace tenure = tenure / 52.18
(113,149 real changes made)

. 
. ** order and label variables
. order person_id year non_int birth* age sex race sample_type educ_enrolled ed
> uc_highest educ_* marital spouse_wkswk spouse_hrswk any_children children age
> children lfstatus wkswk_li worker_type wage tenure experience unemployment ou
> tlf occupation* sector* afqt* self_80_score self_80_zpctl risk_scale fips_bir
> th fips_at14 fips

. 
. label define sex 0 "Female" 1 "Male"

. label val sex sex

. label define educ_enrolled 1 "Not enrolled, completed less than high school" 
> 2 "Enrolled, high school" 3 "Enrolled, educ_college" 4 "Not enrolled, complet
> ed high school"

. label val educ_enrolled educ_enrolled

. label define lfstatus 1 "Working" 2 "With job, not at work" 3 "Unemployed" 4 
> "Keeping house" 5 "Going to school" 6 "Unable to work" 7 "Other" 8 "In active
>  forces"

. label val lfstatus lfstatus

. label define worker_type 1 "Private for profit company" 2 "Government" 3 "Sel
> f-employed" 4 "Without pay" 5 "Working in family business" 6 "Non-profit orga
> nization"

. label val worker_type worker_type

. compress
  variable person_id was float now int
  variable non_int was float now byte
  variable birth_year was float now int
  variable birth_month was float now byte
  variable age was float now byte
  variable sex was float now byte
  variable race was float now byte
  variable sample_type was float now byte
  variable educ_enrolled was float now byte
  variable educ_highest was float now byte
  variable educ_mother was float now byte
  variable educ_father was float now byte
  variable marital was float now byte
  variable spouse_wkswk was float now byte
  variable spouse_hrswk was float now int
  variable any_children was float now byte
  variable children was float now byte
  variable agechildren was float now byte
  variable lfstatus was float now byte
  variable wkswk_li was float now int
  variable worker_type was float now byte
  variable unemployment was float now int
  variable outlf was float now int
  variable occupation3d was float now int
  variable occupation2d was float now byte
  variable sector3d_90 was float now int
  variable sector2d_90 was float now byte
  variable self_80_score was float now byte
  variable self_80_zpctl was float now int
  variable risk_scale was float now byte
  (10,876,356 bytes saved)

. 
. label var person_id "Individual identifier"

. label var year "Year"

. label var non_int "Non-interview indicator"

. label var birth_year "Birth year"

. label var birth_month "Birth month"

. label var age "Age"

. label var sex "Sex"

. label var race "Race"

. label var sample_type "Sample classification"

. label var educ_enrolled "Educational enrollment status"

. label var educ_highest "Highest education attained at survey date"

. label var educ_mother "Mother's years of education"

. label var educ_father "Father's years of education"

. label var marital "Marital status"

. label var spouse_wkswk "Number of weeks worked by spouse in past calendar yea
> r"

. label var spouse_hrswk "Number of hours worked per week by spouse in past cal
> endar year"

. label var any_children "Has at least one child"

. label var children "\# of children (since 2000, only for female respondents a
> nd only bio children)"

. label var agechildren "Age of youngest child (only individuals with children)
> "

. label var lfstatus "Labor force status (generated for selected years)"

. label var wkswk_li "Weeks worked since last interview"

. label var worker_type "Class of worker (job type), CPS definition"

. label var wage "Hourly real wage, main job, dollars, CPS definition (1982-84 
> = 100)"

. label var tenure "Tenure with employer (years)"

. label var experience "Cumulative experience (years)"

. label var unemployment "Cumulative unemployment spells (weeks)"

. label var outlf "Cumulative out-of-labor-force spells (weeks)"

. label var occupation3d "Occupation, CPS definition, 1990 Census 3-digit (stan
> dardized)"

. label var occupation2d "Occupation, CPS definition, 1990 Census 2-digit (stan
> dardized)"

. label var sector3d_90 "3-digit sector (IPUMS consistent long-term classificat
> ion, 1990 basis)"

. label var sector2d_90 "2-digit sector (IPUMS consistent long-term classificat
> ion, 1990 basis)"

. label var afqt_80 "AFQT percentile (full sample), 1980 (revised in 2006)"

. label var self_80_score "Self-confidence, raw score, 1980"

. label var self_80_zpctl "Self-confidence, weighted z score percentile (full s
> ample), 1980"

. label var risk_scale "Risk aversion (10 = fully prepared to take risks)"

. label var fips_birth "Residence FIPS code of birth county"

. label var fips_at14 "Residence FIPS code at age 14"

. label var fips "Residence FIPS code"

. save `tmp_panel', replace
(file /tmp/St10336.000003 not found)
file /tmp/St10336.000003 saved as .dta format

.

. * convert months into days
. foreach var of varlist m_2000 m_2002 m_2004 m_2008 m_2010 m_2012 {
  2.         replace `var' = 0 if `var' == 1
  3.         replace `var' = 31 if `var' == 2
  4.         replace `var' = 31 + 28 if `var' == 3
  5.         replace `var' = 31 + 28 + 31 if `var' == 4
  6.         replace `var' = 31 + 28 + 31 + 30 if `var' == 5
  7.         replace `var' = 31 + 28 + 31 + 30 + 31 if `var' == 6
  8.         replace `var' = 31 + 28 + 31 + 30 + 31 + 30 if `var' == 7
  9.         replace `var' = 31 + 28 + 31 + 30 + 31 + 30 + 31 if `var' == 8
 10.         replace `var' = 31 + 28 + 31 + 30 + 31 + 30 + 31 + 31 if `var' == 
> 9
 11.         replace `var' = 31 + 28 + 31 + 30 + 31 + 30 + 31 + 31 + 30 if `var
> ' == 10
 12.         replace `var' = 31 + 28 + 31 + 30 + 31 + 30 + 31 + 31 + 30 + 31 if
>  `var' == 11
 13.         replace `var' = 31 + 28 + 31 + 30 + 31 + 30 + 31 + 31 + 30 + 31 + 
> 30 if `var' == 12
 14. }

. * create weeks for each month-day combination
. foreach num of numlist 2000 2002 2004 2008 2010 2012 {
  2.         gen date_`num' = int((m_`num' + d_`num')/7) + 1
  3.         replace date_`num' = 52 if date_`num' == 53
  4. }

. * rename weekly arrays to year-week terms
. * 2000
. local i = 1

.         while `i' <= 52 {
  2.         foreach var of varlist W0880200 - W0885300 {
  3.                 rename `var' w_2000_`i'
  4.                 local i = `i' + 1
  5.                 }
  6.         }

. * 2002
. local i = 1

.         while `i' <= 52 {
  2.         foreach var of varlist W0937300 - W0942400 {
  3.                 rename `var' w_2002_`i'
  4.                 local i = `i' + 1
  5.                 }
  6.         }

. * 2004
. local i = 1

.         while `i' <= 52 {
  2.         foreach var of varlist W1002800 - W1008000 {
  3.                 rename `var' w_2004_`i'
  4.                 local i = `i' + 1
  5.                 }
  6.         }

. * 2008
. local i = 1

.         while `i' <= 52 {
  2.         foreach var of varlist W1119600 - W1124700 {
  3.                 rename `var' w_2008_`i'
  4.                 local i = `i' + 1
  5.                 }
  6.         }

. * 2010
. local i = 1

.         while `i' <= 52 {
  2.         foreach var of varlist W1177500 - W1182600 {
  3.                 rename `var' w_2010_`i'
  4.                 local i = `i' + 1
  5.                 }
  6.         }

. * 2012
. local i = 1

.         while `i' <= 52 {
  2.         foreach var of varlist W1253200 - W1258300 {
  3.                 rename `var' w_2012_`i'
  4.                 local i = `i' + 1
  5.                 }
  6.         }

. 
. ** Create labor force status in selected years
. gen lfstatus_2000 = .
(12,686 missing values generated)

. local i = 1

.         while `i' <= 52 {
  2.         foreach var of varlist w_2000_1 - w_2000_52 {
  3.                 replace lfstatus_2000 = `var' if date_2000 == `i'
  4.                 local i = `i' + 1
  5.                 }
  6.         }

. 
. * reshape labur force status data into an individual-year level data set
. rename R0000100 person_id

. keep person_id lfstatus_2000 - lfstatus_2012

. reshape long lfstatus_, i(person_id) j(year)
(j = 2000 2002 2004 2008 2010 2012)

Data                               Wide   ->   Long
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Number of observations           12,686   ->   76,116      
Number of variables                   7   ->   3           
j variable (6 values)                     ->   year
xij variables:
lfstatus_2000 lfstatus_2002 ... lfstatus_2012->lfstatus_
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

. rename lfstatus_ lfstatus_gen

. recode lfstatus_gen 0=. 2=7 4=3 7=8 5=7
(11,604 changes made to lfstatus_gen)

. 
. ** merge with nlsy79 panel data set
. merge 1:1 person_id year using `tmp_panel', keep(using match) nogen
(label vlR0173600 already defined)
(label vlR0214700 already defined)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                       106,154
        from master                         0  
        from using                    106,154  

    Matched                            28,122  
    -----------------------------------------

. replace lfstatus = lfstatus_gen if missing(lfstatus) & (year == 2000 | year =
> = 2002 | year == 2004 | year == 2008 | year == 2010 | year == 2012)
(27,128 real changes made)

. drop lfstatus_gen

. sort person_id year

. 
. * label labor force status
. label define lfst 1 "Working" 2 "With job, not at work" 3 "Unemployed" 4 "Kee
> ping house" 5 "Going to school" 6 "Unable to work" 7 "Other, OLF" 8 "In activ
> e forces"

. label val lfstatus lfst

. label var person_id "Individual identifier"

. label var year "Year"

. label var lfstatus "Labor force status (generated for selected years)"

. 
. * if a fake location history was generated ("$NLSYDisableGeocode" == "1"),
. * keep it only if "$NLSYGenerateFakeLocations" == "1"
. if ("$NLSYDisableGeocode" == "1" & "$NLSYGenerateFakeLocations" != "1") {
.         drop fips_birth fips_at14 fips
. }

. 
. * save panel
. compress
  variable person_id was float now int
  (268,552 bytes saved)

. label data "'City of dreams' De la Roca, Ottaviano & Puga. NLSY Panel"

. sort person_id year

. save ../../data/processed/nlsy_panel, replace
(file ../../data/processed/nlsy_panel.dta not found)
file ../../data/processed/nlsy_panel.dta saved

. describe, fullnames

. use ../../data/processed/nlsy_panel, clear
('City of dreams' De la Roca, Ottaviano & Puga. NLSY Panel)

. 
. ** CPS
. do ipums_cps_msa

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
> ipums_cps_msa.do
> 
> Stata do file used to proccess CPS data from IPUMS ASEC source files for
> 'Urban growth and its aggregate implications',
> by Gilles Duranton and Diego Puga
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
. 
. set more off

. 
. clear

. quietly infix                 ///
>         int     year       1-4      ///
>         long    serial     5-9      ///
>         byte    month      10-11    ///
>         double  cpsid      12-25    ///
>         byte    asecflag   26-26    ///
>         byte    hflag      27-27    ///
>         double  asecwth    28-37    ///
>         byte    msapmsz    38-39    ///
>         byte    region     40-41    ///
>         byte    statefip   42-43    ///
>         byte    metro      44-44    ///
>         int     metarea    45-48    ///
>         long    county     49-53    ///
>         byte    cbsasz     54-55    ///
>         byte    msacmsz    56-57    ///
>         long    metfips    58-62    ///
>         byte    individcc  63-63    ///
>         byte    pernum     64-65    ///
>         double  cpsidp     66-79    ///
>         double  asecwt     80-89    ///
>         int     relate     90-93    ///
>         byte    age        94-95    ///
>         byte    sex        96-96    ///
>         int     race       97-99    ///
>         byte    marst      100-100  ///
>         byte    asian      101-102  ///
>         long    bpl        103-107  ///
>         byte    nativity   108-108  ///
>         int     hispan     109-111  ///
>         byte    empstat    112-113  ///
>         int     ind1990    114-116  ///
>         byte    classwkr   117-118  ///
>         int     uhrswork1  119-121  ///
>         byte    qempstat   122-122  ///
>         int     educ       123-125  ///
>         using "../../data/src/cps/ipums_cps.dat"

. 
. replace asecwth   = asecwth   / 10000
(7,177,649 real changes made)

. replace asecwt    = asecwt    / 10000
(7,177,653 real changes made)

. 
. format cpsid     %14.0f

. format asecwth   %10.4f

. format cpsidp    %14.0f

. format asecwt    %10.4f

. 
. label var year      `"Survey year"'

. label var serial    `"Household serial number"'

. label var month     `"Month"'

. label var cpsid     `"CPSID, household record"'

. label var asecflag  `"Flag for ASEC"'

. label var hflag     `"Flag for the 3/8 file 2014"'

. label var asecwth   `"Annual Social and Economic Supplement Household weight"
> '

. label var msapmsz   `"Metropolitan area size (PMSA/MSA)"'

. * sample restrictions
. * keep years after 1985
. drop if year < 1984
(1,159,282 observations deleted)

. * keep working age individuals
. drop if age < 25 | age > 64
(2,942,950 observations deleted)

. * drop puerto rico, hawaii, alaska
. drop if statefip == 72
(0 observations deleted)

. drop if statefip == 15
(42,889 observations deleted)

. drop if statefip == 2
(42,490 observations deleted)

. * drop active military forces
. drop if empstat == 1
(14,759 observations deleted)

. * assign msa based on county if available
. rename county fips

. * 1997: Dade county, FL (FIPS 12025) is renamed as Miami-Dade county, FL (FIP
> S 12086)
. replace fips = 12086 if fips == 12025
(6,411 real changes made)

. merge m:1 fips using ../../data/processed/county2msa1999, keepusing(msa msa_n
> ame)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                     2,136,400
        from master                 2,135,931  (_merge==1)
        from using                        469  (_merge==2)

    Matched                           839,546  (_merge==3)

. drop if _merge == 2
(469 observations deleted)

. drop _merge

. rename (fips msa) (county msa_fromcounty)

. * if county missing, use metarea if it matches a 1999 msa

. replace new_england = 1 if statefip == 9 | statefip == 23 | statefip == 25 | 
> statefip == 33 | statefip == 44 | statefip == 50
(275,977 real changes made)

. gen msa = metarea if missing(msa_fromcounty) & new_england == 0
(1,106,946 missing values generated)

. merge m:1 msa using ../../data/processed/citypop_msa_necma, keepusing(msa_nam
> e) update

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------

        from master                 2,434,725  (_merge==1)

        nonmissing conflict                 0  (_merge==5)

. drop if _merge == 2
(96 observations deleted)

. replace msa_fromcounty = msa if !missing(msa) & _merge >= 3
(540,752 real changes made)

. rename msa_fromcounty msa

. * otherwise use metarea to msa crosswalk

> sa_name) update

        from master                 1,791,668  (_merge==1)

. drop _merge

. merge m:1 msa using ../../data/processed/citypop_msa_necma, keepusing(pop2010
> )

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                     1,595,222
        from master                 1,595,179  (_merge==1)
        from using                         43  (_merge==2)

    Matched                         1,380,298  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. drop if _merge == 2
(43 observations deleted)

. rename pop2010 msa_pop2010

. label var msa "MSA/NECMA FIPS code (1999 definitions)"

. label var msa_pop2010 "MSA/NECMA Population 2010"

. * select variables

>  age sex empstat educ

> z age sex empstat educ

. * save data
. label data "'Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. CP
> S"

. compress
  (0 bytes saved)

. save ../../data/processed/ipums_cps, replace
file ../../data/processed/ipums_cps.dta saved

. describe, fullnames

                                                implications' Duranton & Puga.
                                                CPS
    Variables:            14                  17 Jun 2023 11:36
                                              (_dta has notes)

                                                definitions)

. cd ..
/home/urban/hcgrowth/empirics/code

. 
end of do-file

. timer off 1

. 
. * perform analysis
. timer on 2

. do 2_hcgrowth_analysis.do

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
> 2_hcgrowth_analysis.do
> 
> Stata do file to perform analysis for
> 'Urban growth and its aggregate implications',
> by Gilles Duranton and Diego Puga, Econometrica
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
. 
. * initialise
. clear

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. 
. cd analysis
/home/urban/hcgrowth/empirics/code/analysis

. 
. * college share
. do hcgrowth_college

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
> hcgrowth_college.do
> 
> Stata do file to replicate the college share plot for
> 'Urban growth and its aggregate implications',
> by Gilles Duranton and Diego Puga
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
. 
. * initialise
. clear

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. 
. *** college share plot
. * read cps data
. use ../../data/processed/ipums_cps, clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. CPS)

. * college indicator
. gen college = 1 if educ >= 110 & age >= 25
(2,139,569 missing values generated)

. replace college = 0 if missing(college) & age >= 25
(2,139,569 real changes made)

. * drop outside of metro areas
. drop if missing(msa) & (metro == 1 | metarea >= 9997)
(833,973 observations deleted)

. * aggregate by city size categories
. gen size = .
(2,141,504 missing values generated)

. replace size = 1 if !missing(msa) & msa_pop2010 < 1000000
(454,687 real changes made)

. replace size = 2 if !missing(msa) & msa_pop2010 >= 1000000 & msa_pop2010 <= 2
> 500000
(302,448 real changes made)

. replace size = 3 if !missing(msa) & msa_pop2010 > 2500000
(623,163 real changes made)

. replace size = 1 if missing(size) & (msacmsz >= 1 & msacmsz <= 3)
(31,884 real changes made)

. replace size = 2 if missing(size) & msacmsz == 4
(62,987 real changes made)

. replace size = 3 if missing(size) & (msacmsz == 5 | msacmsz == 6)
(302,497 real changes made)

. replace size = 1 if missing(size) & (cbsasz >= 1 & cbsasz <= 3)
(104,648 real changes made)

. replace size = 2 if missing(size) & cbsasz == 4
(78,001 real changes made)

. replace size = 3 if missing(size) & (cbsasz == 5 | cbsasz == 6)
(106,502 real changes made)

. drop if missing(size)
(74,687 observations deleted)

. collapse college [pweight=asecwt], by (year size)

. reshape wide college, i(year) j(size)
(j = 1 2 3)

Data                               Long   ->   Wide
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Number of observations              102   ->   34          
Number of variables                   3   ->   4           
j variable (3 values)              size   ->   (dropped)
xij variables:
                                college   ->   college1 college2 college3
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

. tsset year, yearly

Time variable: year, 1984 to 2017
        Delta: 1 year

. * plot
. tssmooth ma college_big = college3, window(2 1 2)
The smoother applied was
     (1/5)*[x(t-2) + x(t-1) + 1*x(t) + x(t+1) + x(t+2)]; x(t)= college3

. tssmooth ma college_med = college2, window(2 1 2)
The smoother applied was
     (1/5)*[x(t-2) + x(t-1) + 1*x(t) + x(t+1) + x(t+2)]; x(t)= college2

. tssmooth ma college_sml = college1, window(2 1 2)
The smoother applied was
     (1/5)*[x(t-2) + x(t-1) + 1*x(t) + x(t+1) + x(t+2)]; x(t)= college1

. keep if year >= 1986 & year <= 2016
(3 observations deleted)

. twoway (line college_sml year, sort lwidth(medthick) lcolor(midgreen)) /*
> */ (line college_med year, sort lwidth(medthick) lcolor(dknavy)) /*
> */ (line college_big year, sort lwidth(medthick) lcolor(red)), /*
> */ xsize(10) ysize(7) /*
> */ ytitle("") l2title("Share of population aged 25-64 with a college degree")
>  /*
> */ ylabel(0.2 "20%" 0.25 "25%" 0.3 "30%" 0.35 "35%" 0.4 "40%" ,labsize(small)
> ) /*
> */ yscale(range(0.18 0.42)) /*
> */ xtitle("Years") /*
> */ xlabel(1986(5)2016, format(%9.0g) labsize(medsmall)) /*
> */ plotr(m(zero)) legend(off) /*
> */ legend(label(1 "100,000 - 999,999") label(2 "1,000,000 - 2,499,999") label
> (3 "2,500,000 - 4,999,999") label(4 "5,000,000 +") rows(4) symxsize(4) size(v
> small) ring(0) position(10) region(style(none)))

. * save plot
. graph export "../../results/hcgrowth_fig3.png", as(png) replace
(file ../../results/hcgrowth_fig3.png not found)
file ../../results/hcgrowth_fig3.png written in PNG format

. graph export "../../results/hcgrowth_fig3.eps", as(eps) replace
(file ../../results/hcgrowth_fig3.eps not found)
file ../../results/hcgrowth_fig3.eps saved as EPS format

. 
. 
end of do-file

. 
. * speed
. * only if block-group location  data is available 
. if ("$NHTSBGUnavailable" != "1") {
.         do hcgrowth_speed

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
> hcgrowth_speed.do
> 
> Stata do file to calculate city speed
> 'Urban growth and its aggregate implications',
> by Gilles Duranton and Diego Puga
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
. 
. * initialise
. clear

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. 
. tempfile tmp_msa

. 
. ** speed calculation
. * trip controls
. local c_trip "ln_trip_km i.travday i.whytrp90 i.time_dum"

. * household and neighbourhood controls
. local c_hh "ln_hh_size ln_hh_drivers hh_male_sh hh_single hh_smallchild hh_hi
> spanic hh_black hh_white hh_asian hh_renter"

. local c_neighb "bg_pc_pop_* bg_no_school bg_school_x_rank bg_by_coast bg_by_r
> iver bg_tri"

. * read data
. use ../../data/processed/travel_nhts_trip, clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. NHTS trip)

. * drop college towns
. drop if college_town == 1
(20,592 observations deleted)

. * no school rank indicator and interaction
. gen bg_no_school = 0

. replace bg_no_school = 1 if missing(bg_school_rank)
(168,262 real changes made)

. gen bg_school_x_rank = bg_school_rank
(168,262 missing values generated)

. replace bg_school_x_rank = 0 if bg_no_school == 1
(168,262 real changes made)

. * travel times (30 mn time dummies);
. gen temp1=floor(strttime/100)*60
(33 missing values generated)

. gen temp2=strttime-floor(strttime/100)*100
(33 missing values generated)

. gen temp3= temp1+temp2
(33 missing values generated)

. gen time_dum = floor(temp3/30)
(33 missing values generated)

. drop temp*

. * log variables
. gen ln_dist2cbd=ln(dist2cbd)

. gen ln_dist2work=ln(dist2work)
(235,343 missing values generated)

. gen ln_hh_size = ln(hh_size)

. gen ln_hh_drivers = ln(hh_drivers)

. gen ln_trip_kph = ln(trip_kph)

. gen ln_trip_km = ln(trip_km)

. * keep cities with at least 100 observations
. preserve

. gen msaobs = 1

. collapse (sum) msaobs, by(msa msa_name)

. keep if !missing(msaobs) & msaobs >= 100
(46 observations deleted)

. save `tmp_msa', replace
(file /tmp/St10336.000001 not found)
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. restore

. merge m:1 msa using `tmp_msa'

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                         2,329
        from master                     2,329  (_merge==1)
        from using                          0  (_merge==2)

    Matched                           501,132  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. keep if _merge == 3
(2,329 observations deleted)

. drop _merge

. * speed regression
. reg ln_trip_kph ln_dist2cbd `c_trip' `c_hh' `c_neighb' i.msa, robust

Linear regression                               Number of obs     =    498,486
                                                F(263, 498222)    =    2026.38
                                                Prob > F          =     0.0000
                                                R-squared         =     0.5929
                                                Root MSE          =     .42434

          4  |  -.0051446   .0309132    -0.17   0.868    -.0657334    .0554443
          5  |   .0716918   .0368921     1.94   0.052    -.0006156    .1439991

. do hcgrowth_gamma_theta

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------

. 
. *** gamma: using cross-city variation in city-centre housing monthly rents de
> pending on spatial extent
. 
. ** city-centre housing monthly rent calculation
. use `tmp_bg', clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. ACS Block Group
> )

. * centre neighbourhoood controls by msa and dwelling controls nationally
. foreach var of varlist `c_neighb' {
  2.         bys msa: egen a`var' = mean(`var')
  3.         gen b`var' =  `var' - a`var'
  4.         drop `var' a`var'
  5.         rename b`var' `var'
  6. }

. foreach var of varlist `c_dwelling' {
  2.         egen a`var' = mean(`var')
  3.         gen b`var' =  `var' - a`var'
  4.         drop `var' a`var'
  5.         rename b`var' `var'
  6. }

. * housing price variable
. gen ln_housing_price = ln(contractrent_median)

. * regression for city-centre and city-periphery house prices
. reg ln_housing_price dist2cbd dist2cbd2 dist2cbd3 i.msa `c_neighb' `c_dwellin
> g', robust cluster(msa)

. * save msa fixed-effects (housing price minus constant when distance is 0)
. regsave using `tmp_reg', replace
(file /tmp/St10336.000003 not found)
file /tmp/St10336.000003 saved as .dta format

. use `tmp_reg', clear

. drop if var == "_cons"
(1 observation deleted)

. split var, p(".")
variables created as string: 
var1  var2

. keep if var2 == "msa"
(33 observations deleted)

. split var1, p("b")
variable created as string: 
var11

. rename var11 msa

. destring msa, replace
msa: all characters numeric; replaced as int

. rename coef msa_fe

. rename stderr msa_fe_se

. keep msa msa_fe msa_fe_se

. save `tmp_reg', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000003 saved as .dta format

. * save msa distance coefficients
. gen msa_dist = _coef[dist2cbd]

. gen msa_dist2 = _coef[dist2cbd2]

. gen msa_dist3 = _coef[dist2cbd3]

. * combine with periphery distance
. merge m:1 msa using `tmp_msa', keepusing(msa_name hunits dist2cbd_edge)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                            46
        from master                         0  (_merge==1)
        from using                         46  (_merge==2)

    Matched                               229  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. drop _merge

. * must add constant to obtain log housing price at msa centre
. gen ln_housing_price_cc = msa_fe + _b[_cons]
(46 missing values generated)

. * city-centre housing monthly rent corrected under assumption of error normal
> ity
. gen housing_price_cc = exp(ln_housing_price_cc + (msa_fe_se^2 / 2))
(46 missing values generated)

. * log periphery housing monthly rent
. gen ln_housing_price_per = ln_housing_price_cc + msa_dist * dist2cbd_edge + m
> sa_dist2 * (dist2cbd_edge)^2 + msa_dist3 * (dist2cbd_edge)^3
(46 missing values generated)

. * log periphery housing monthly rent corrected under assumption of error norm
> ality
. gen housing_price_per = exp(ln_housing_price_per + (msa_fe_se^2 / 2))
(46 missing values generated)

. * save relevant msa variables
. label var msa "MSA/NECMA FIPS code (1999 definitions)"

. label var housing_price_cc "City-centre housing monthly rent ($)"

. label var housing_price_per "City-periphery housing monthly rent ($)"

. label var ln_housing_price_cc "Log city-centre housing monthly rent"

. label var ln_housing_price_per "Log city-periphery housing monthly rent"

. label var hunits "Housing units"

. label var dist2cbd_edge "City edge distance to CBD (km.)"

. order msa msa_name ln_housing_price_cc ln_housing_price_per housing_price_cc 
> housing_price_per hunits dist2cbd_edge

. keep msa msa_name ln_housing_price_cc ln_housing_price_per housing_price_cc h
> ousing_price_per hunits dist2cbd_edge

. compress
  variable hunits was double now long
  (1,100 bytes saved)

. sort msa

. save `tmp_msa', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000002 saved as .dta format

. 
. ** periphery housing value calculation
. ** (this is not nedded here, but since the data is ready, calculate for regul
> ation diagrams)
. use `tmp_bg', clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. ACS Block Group
> )

. * centre neighbourhoood controls by msa
. * recall reference is 4-bedroom single-family detached built 2000-2009
. foreach var of varlist `c_neighb' {
  2.         bys msa: egen a`var' = mean(`var')
  3.         gen b`var' =  `var' - a`var'
  4.         drop `var' a`var'
  5.         rename b`var' `var'
  6. }

. * housing value variable
. gen ln_housing_value = ln(value_median)
(4,629 missing values generated)

. * regression for city-centre and city-periphery house values
. reg ln_housing_value dist2cbd dist2cbd2 dist2cbd3 i.msa `c_neighb' `c_dwellin
> g', robust cluster(msa)

       _cons |   12.80326   .0645605   198.31   0.000     12.67605    12.93047
------------------------------------------------------------------------------

. * save msa fixed-effects (housing value minus constant when distance is 0)
. regsave using `tmp_reg', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000003 saved as .dta format

. use `tmp_reg', clear

. drop if var == "_cons"
(1 observation deleted)

. split var, p(".")
variables created as string: 
var1  var2

. keep if var2 == "msa"
(33 observations deleted)

. split var1, p("b")
variable created as string: 
var11

. rename var11 msa

. destring msa, replace
msa: all characters numeric; replaced as int

. rename coef msa_fe

. rename stderr msa_fe_se

. keep msa msa_fe msa_fe_se

. save `tmp_reg', replace
file /tmp/St10336.000003 saved as .dta format

. * save msa distance coefficients
. gen msa_dist = _coef[dist2cbd]

. gen msa_dist2 = _coef[dist2cbd2]

. gen msa_dist3 = _coef[dist2cbd3]

. * combine with periphery distance
. merge m:1 msa using `tmp_msa', keepusing(msa_name dist2cbd_edge)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                            46
        from master                         0  (_merge==1)
        from using                         46  (_merge==2)

    Matched                               229  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. drop _merge

. * must add constant to obtain log housing value at msa centre
. gen ln_housing_value_cc = msa_fe + _b[_cons]
(46 missing values generated)

. * city-centre housing value corrected under assumption of error normality
. gen housing_value_cc = exp(ln_housing_value_cc + (msa_fe_se^2 / 2))
(46 missing values generated)

. * log periphery housing value
. gen ln_housing_value_per = ln_housing_value_cc + msa_dist * dist2cbd_edge + m
> sa_dist2 * (dist2cbd_edge)^2 + msa_dist3 * (dist2cbd_edge)^3
(46 missing values generated)

. gen housing_value_per = exp(ln_housing_value_per + (msa_fe_se^2 / 2))
(46 missing values generated)

. * save relevant msa variables
. label var msa "MSA/NECMA FIPS code (1999 definitions)"

. label var housing_value_per "City-periphery housing value ($)"

. label var ln_housing_value_per "Log city-periphery housing value"

. keep msa housing_value_per ln_housing_value_per

. 
. ** combine housing rent and value calculations for later use
. merge m:1 msa using `tmp_msa'

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                             0
    Matched                               275  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. drop _merge

. order msa msa_name ln_housing_price_cc housing_price_cc ln_housing_price_per 
> housing_price_per ln_housing_value_per housing_value_per hunits dist2cbd_edge

. keep msa msa_name ln_housing_price_cc housing_price_cc ln_housing_price_per h
> ousing_price_per ln_housing_value_per housing_value_per hunits dist2cbd_edge

. label data "'Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. Pa
> rtial housing estimates"
note: label truncated to 80 characters

. save ../../data/intermediate/hcgrowth_msa_housing, replace
(file ../../data/intermediate/hcgrowth_msa_housing.dta not found)
file ../../data/intermediate/hcgrowth_msa_housing.dta saved

. 
. ** combine with speed estimates
. merge 1:1 msa using ../../results/hcgrowth_table1_speed

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                            66
        from master                        66  (_merge==1)
        from using                          0  (_merge==2)

    Matched                               209  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. tab _merge

   Matching result from |
                  merge |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.

            Matched (3) |        209       76.00      100.00

                  Total |        275      100.00

. drop _merge

. 
. ** gamma estimation
. * take logs
. gen ln_edge = ln(dist2cbd_edge)

. * set parameters
. summarize housing_price_cc, detail

            City-centre housing monthly rent ($)
-------------------------------------------------------------
      Percentiles      Smallest
 1%     433.4986       398.7883
 5%     464.1628       418.9825
10%     491.7741       433.4986       Obs                 229
25%     563.4935       434.4206       Sum of wgt.         229

50%     651.9686                      Mean           687.3479
                        Largest       Std. dev.      190.9465
75%     778.0748       1334.455
90%     917.3809       1404.428       Variance       36460.58
95%     1039.608       1456.242       Skewness       1.644536
99%     1404.428       1625.925       Kurtosis        7.07143

. local p_marginal `r(min)'

. display `p_marginal'
398.7883

. local sigma  = 0.04

. local beta   = 0.04

. local gamma = 0.07

. local theta  = 0.04

. local c = ((`gamma' + `theta' - `sigma' - `beta')/((`sigma' + `beta') * (`gam
> ma' + 1)) )* `p_marginal'

. display `c'
139.76225

. gen ln_housing_price_cc_plus_c = ln(housing_price_cc + `c')
(46 missing values generated)

. local itno = 0

. local gamma_diff = 1000

. while `gamma_diff' > 0.00001 {
  2.   quiet{
  3.         local itno = `itno' + 1
  4.         local gamma_prev = `gamma'
  5.         * regression
.         replace ln_housing_price_cc_plus_c = ln(housing_price_cc + `c')
  6.         reg ln_housing_price_cc_plus_c ln_edge ln_msa_speed
  7.         local gamma : di %9.8f _coef[ln_edge]
  8.         local gamma_diff = abs(`gamma_prev' - `gamma')
  9.         local c = ((`gamma' + `theta' - `sigma' - `beta')/((`sigma' + `bet
> a') * (`gamma' + 1)) )* `p_marginal'
 10.   }
 11.   display "Iteration `itno': gamma = `gamma'"
 12. }
Iteration 1: gamma = 0.07358709
Iteration 2: gamma = 0.07231964
Iteration 3: gamma = 0.07276126
Iteration 4: gamma = 0.07260661
Iteration 5: gamma = 0.07266066
Iteration 6: gamma = 0.07264177
Iteration 7: gamma = 0.07264838

. * save estimation results for latex table
. reg ln_housing_price_cc_plus_c ln_edge ln_msa_speed

      Source |       SS           df       MS      Number of obs   =       182
-------------+----------------------------------   F(2, 179)       =     50.61
       Model |  2.63942734         2  1.31971367   Prob > F        =    0.0000
    Residual |  4.66784277       179  .026077334   R-squared       =    0.3612
-------------+----------------------------------   Adj R-squared   =    0.3541
       Total |  7.30727011       181  .040371658   Root MSE        =    .16148

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------+----------------------------------------------------------------
     ln_edge |   .0726484   .0248478     2.92   0.004     .0236161    .1216807
ln_msa_speed |  -1.344431   .2100377    -6.40   0.000      -1.7589   -.9299627
       _cons |   11.44535   .8278694    13.83   0.000     9.811714    13.07899
------------------------------------------------------------------------------

. local gamma_3_coef : di %9.4f _coef[ln_edge]

. local gamma_3_se : di %9.4f _se[ln_edge]

. local speed_3_coef : di %9.4f _coef[ln_msa_speed]

. local speed_3_se : di %9.4f _se[ln_msa_speed]

. local gamma_3_obs : di %9.0fc e(N)

. local gamma_3_r2 : di %9.3f e(r2)

. 
. *** theta: using cross-city variation in travel speed depending on population
>  (nhts)
. use ../../results/hcgrowth_table1_speed, clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. Speed estimates
> )

. * merge population

. *** write latex file
. file open texfile using ../../results/hcgrowth_table1.tex, write replace
(file ../../results/hcgrowth_table1.tex not found)

. file write texfile "Log distance to city centre & " `"`gamma_1_coef'"' "$^{**
> *}$ & " `"`gamma_2_coef'"' "$^{***}$ & & & \\" _n

. file write texfile "& \raisebox{.7ex}[0pt]{\scriptsize (" `"`gamma_1_se'"' ")
> } & \raisebox{.7ex}[0pt]{\scriptsize (" `"`gamma_2_se'"' ")} & & & \\" _n

> ^{***}$ & & \\" _n

. file write texfile "& & & \raisebox{.7ex}[0pt]{\scriptsize (" `"`gamma_3_se'"
> ' ")} & & \\[-0.5ex]" _n

. file write texfile "\midrule" _n

. file write texfile "Log city population & & & & " `"`theta_1_coef'"' "$^{***}
> $ & " `"`theta_2_coef'"' "$^{***}$\\" _n

. file write texfile "& & & & \raisebox{.7ex}[0pt]{\scriptsize (" `"`theta_1_se
> '"' ")} &  \raisebox{.7ex}[0pt]{\scriptsize (" `"`theta_2_se'"' ")} \\[-0.5ex
> ]" _n

. file write texfile "\midrule" _n

. file write texfile "Log city travel speed & & & "  `"`speed_3_coef'"' "$^{***
> }$ & & \\" _n

. file write texfile "& & & \raisebox{.7ex}[0pt]{\scriptsize (" `"`speed_3_se'"
> ' ")} & & \\" _n

. file write texfile "City indicators &  Yes &  Yes & & & \\" _n

. file write texfile "& & & & & \\" _n

. file write texfile "Controls & {\small Block-group} & {\small Block-group} & 
> {\small For house price} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{\small For speed}\\" _n

. file write texfile "& {\small \& household} & {\small \& dwelling} & {\small 
> and speed} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{\small variable}\\" _n

. file write texfile "& & & {\small variable} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{\small const
> ruction}\\" _n

. file write texfile "& & & {\small construction} & & \\[0.7ex]" _n

. file write texfile "Observations & " `"`gamma_1_obs'"' " & " `"`gamma_2_obs'"
> ' " & " `"`gamma_3_obs'"'  "  & " `"`theta_1_obs'"'  " & " `"`theta_2_obs'"' 
> "\\" _n

. file write texfile "& households & block-groups & cities & cities & cities\\[
> 0.7ex]" _n

. file write texfile "$ R^2$ & " `"`gamma_1_r2'"' " & " `"`gamma_2_r2'"' " & " 
> `"`gamma_3_r2'"' " & " `"`theta_1_r2'"' " & " `"`theta_2_r2'"' "\\" _n

. file close texfile

. 
end of do-file

.         
. * sigma and beta
. * only if geocode data is available or if fake location data has been generat
> ed 
. if ("$NLSYGeocodeUnavailable" != "1" | "$NLSYGenerateFakeLocations" == "1") {
.         do hcgrowth_sigma_beta

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
> hcgrowth_sigma_beta.do
> 
> Stata do file to estimate sigma and beta for
> 'Urban growth and its aggregate implications',
> by Gilles Duranton and Diego Puga
> 
> Replicates De la Roca and Puga (REStud, 2017) on NLSY data
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
. 
. * initialise
. clear

. clear matrix

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. 
. * define locals and tempfiles
. local size_big = 5000000

. local size_med = 2000000

. local controls_a "exp_big exp_big_exp exp_med exp_med_exp exp exp2"

. local controls_b "tenure tenure2 i.occupation2d i.sector2d_90 i.year"

. local instrument "msa_cc30km_steep msa_cc30km_wetland ln_pop1850 ln_pop1920 l
> n_eastseab msa_hdd"

. tempfile tmp_panel

. tempfile tmp_msa

. tempfile tmp_msag

. tempfile tmp_premia

. tempfile tmp_coeff

. 
. ** read panel
. use ../../data/processed/nlsy_panel, clear
('City of dreams' De la Roca, Ottaviano & Puga. NLSY Panel)

. * adjust wages from 1982-84 to 2012 $ (for consistency, but irrelevant since 
> using ln_wage)
. preserve

. use ../../data/processed/us_nation_totals, clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. US totals)

. sum cpi if year == 2012, meanonly

. local cpi_2012 = r(mean)

. restore

. replace wage = wage / (100 / `cpi_2012')
(106,662 real changes made)

. label var wage "Hourly real wage, main job, dollars, CPS definition (2012 $)"

. 
. ** assign msa codes
. 
. * assign msa codes and msa population for county at age of birth

('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. City Definition
> s )

. save `tmp_msa', replace

. drop _merge

. rename (msa msa_name pop2010) (msa msa_name msa_pop2010)

. label var msa_birth "MSA id of birth county"

. label var msa_name_birth "MSA name of birth county"

. label var msa_pop2010_birth "MSA 2010 population of birth county"

. label var msa_at14 "MSA id of county at age 14"

. label var msa_name_at14 "MSA name of county at age 14"

. label var msa_pop2010_at14 "MSA 2010 population of county at age 14"

. label var msa "MSA identifier (1999 definition)"

. label var msa_name "MSA name"

. label var msa_pop2010 "MSA 2010 population"

. 
. ** generate extra variables
. sort person_id year

. replace msa_pop2010 = 0 if missing(msa_pop2010)
(34,310 real changes made)

. * big-city indicator
. gen big = .
(134,276 missing values generated)

. replace big = 1 if msa_pop2010 >= `size_big'
(34,458 real changes made)

. replace big = 0 if msa_pop2010 < `size_big'
(99,818 real changes made)

. * big-city experience
. * (if location missing assign experience to previous known location)
. replace big = big[_n-1] if missing(fips) & person_id == person_id[_n-1]
(1,778 real changes made)

. by person_id: gen exp_big = sum(wkswk_li) if big == 1
(98,040 missing values generated)

. replace exp_big = 0 if missing(exp_big)
(98,040 real changes made)

. replace exp_big = exp_big[_n-1] if exp_big == 0 & person_id == person_id[_n-1
> ]
(11,886 real changes made)

. * intermediate-city indicator
. gen med = .
(134,276 missing values generated)

. replace med = 1 if msa_pop2010 >= `size_med' & msa_pop2010 < `size_big'
(17,911 real changes made)

. replace med = 0 if msa_pop2010 < `size_med' | msa_pop2010 >= `size_big'
(116,365 real changes made)

. * intermediate-city experience
. replace med = med[_n-1] if missing(fips) & person_id == person_id[_n-1]
(1,044 real changes made)

. by person_id: gen exp_med = sum(wkswk_li) if med == 1
(115,321 missing values generated)

. replace exp_med = 0 if missing(exp_med)
(115,321 real changes made)

. replace exp_med = exp_med[_n-1] if exp_med == 0 & person_id == person_id[_n-1
> ]
(8,167 real changes made)

. * convert city-specific experience and tenure from weeks to years
. * (conversion to years for overall experience and tenure already done)
. rename experience exp

. replace exp_big = exp_big / 52.18
(46,331 real changes made)

. replace exp_med = exp_med / 52.18
(26,424 real changes made)

. * experience and tenure squared
. foreach var of varlist exp tenure {
  2.         gen `var'2 = `var' * `var'
  3. }
(4,541 missing values generated)
(21,127 missing values generated)

. * experience interactions
. gen exp_big_exp = exp_big * exp
(4,541 missing values generated)

. gen exp_med_exp = exp_med * exp
(4,541 missing values generated)

. 
. ** calculate and record mean local experience
. preserve

. sort person_id year

. replace msa = msa[_n-1] if missing(msa) & person_id == person_id[_n-1]
(16,762 real changes made)

. sort person_id msa year

. by person_id msa: gen uexp_current = sum(wkswk_li)

. replace uexp_current = uexp_current / 52.18
(127,515 real changes made)

. sort person_id year

. summarize uexp_current, meanonly

. local mean_exp `r(mean)'

. disp `mean_exp'
8.2331687

. restore

. 
. ** additional sample restrictions
. * drop if missing location data
. drop if missing(fips)
(7,021 observations deleted)

. * keep only working episodes
. keep if lfstatus == 1
(37,040 observations deleted)

. * keep workers in private sector (for profit firms)
. keep if worker_type == 1
(21,222 observations deleted)

. 
. ** make aggregates of similarly-sized cities for location fixed effects to be
>  computed on the basis of enough individuals
. preserve

. use ../../data/processed/citypop_msa_necma, clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. City Sizes USA)

. gen msa_g = msa

. replace msa_g = 990100 if pop2010 < 100000
(14 real changes made)

. forvalues i = 100(25)600 {
  2.         replace msa_g = 990`i' if pop2010 > (`i' - 25) * 1000 & pop2010 <=
>  `i' * 1000
  3. }

. egen msa_g_pop = mean(pop2010), by (msa_g)

. keep msa msa_name pop2010 pop1850 pop1920 msa_g msa_g_pop

. * merge additional city variables
. merge 1:1 msa using ../../data/processed/controls_msa

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                             0
    Matched                               275  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. drop _merge

. gen ln_pop = ln(pop2010)

. gen ln_pop1850 = asinh(pop1850)

. gen ln_pop1920 = asinh(pop1920)

. gen ln_eastseab = asinh(msa_eastseab)

. save "`tmp_msa'", replace
file /tmp/St10336.000002 saved as .dta format

. 
. ** combine with nlsy panel
. restore

. merge m:1 msa using "`tmp_msa'", keep(master match) nogen

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                        13,762
        from master                    13,762  
        from using                          0  

    Matched                            55,231  
    -----------------------------------------

. 
. ** ensure same observations throughout and no singletons
. * ensure same observations used throughout (use tsls as reference)
. * nobs with all variables present
. gen ln_wage = ln(wage)
(2,011 missing values generated)

. egen miss = rowmiss(ln_wage `controls_a' tenure tenure2 occupation2d sector2d
> _90 year ln_pop `instrument')

. drop if miss > 0
(17,848 observations deleted)

. drop miss

. * more than 1 obs per person
. by person_id, sort: egen num_obs = count(ln_wage)

. drop if num_obs == 1
(337 observations deleted)

. drop num_obs

. * more than 1 obs per city
. by msa_g, sort: egen num_obs = count(ln_wage)

. drop if num_obs == 1
(0 observations deleted)

. drop num_obs

. * occupation2d has more than 1 person
. egen tag = tag(person_id occupation2d)

. egen num_obs = total(tag), by(occupation2d)

. drop if num_obs == 1
(1 observation deleted)

. drop tag num_obs

. * sector2d_90 has more than 1 person
. egen tag = tag(person_id sector2d_90)

. egen num_obs = total(tag), by(sector2d_90)

. drop if num_obs == 1
(0 observations deleted)

. drop tag num_obs

. save "`tmp_panel'", replace
(file /tmp/St10336.000001 not found)
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. 
. ** iv 1st stage
. use "`tmp_panel'", clear
('City of dreams' De la Roca, Ottaviano & Puga. NLSY Panel)

. xtset person_id year

         Delta: 1 unit

. * calculate short-term and medium-term urban premia

. split var, p(".")

. drop if missing(msa_g)

('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. City Sizes USA)

. drop _merge

. gen uexp_big = _b[exp_big] * `mean_exp' if msa_g_pop >= `size_big'
(52 missing values generated)

. gen uexp_big_exp = _b[exp_big_exp] * `mean_exp'^2 if msa_g_pop >= `size_big'
(52 missing values generated)

. gen uexp_med  = _b[exp_med] * `mean_exp' if msa_g_pop >= `size_med' & msa_g_p
> op < `size_big'
(48 missing values generated)

. gen uexp_med_exp = _b[exp_med_exp] * `mean_exp'^2 if msa_g_pop >= `size_med' 
> & msa_g_pop < `size_big'
(48 missing values generated)

. egen premium_exp = rowtotal(uexp_big-uexp_med_exp)

. gen premium_medterm = premium_initial + premium_exp

. drop premium_exp uexp_*

. summarize premium_medterm

. * regulation diagrams
. do hcgrowth_gradients

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
> hcgrowth_gradients.do
> 
> Stata do file to plot city housing gradients for
> 'Urban growth and its aggregate implications',

. 
. * initialise
. clear

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. tempfile tmp_bg

. tempfile tmp_msa

. tempfile tmp_reg

. 
. * switch to centre neighbourhoood controls by msa and dwelling controls natio
> nally
. local centre_controls_msa = 1

. * neighbourhoood controls
. local c_neighb "pc_pop_* no_school school_x_rank by_coast by_river tri"

. * dwelling controls: reference is 4-bedroom single-family detached built 2000
> -2009
. local c_dwelling "pc_yearbuilt_2010_later pc_yearbuilt_1990_1999-pc_yearbuilt
> _1939_earlier pc_structure_1attached-pc_structure_other pc_bedrooms_0-pc_bedr
> ooms_3 pc_bedrooms_5plus"

. * read data
. use ../../data/processed/housing_blockg_acs, clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. ACS Block Group
> )

. * drop college towns
. drop if college_town == 1
(7,938 observations deleted)

. * no school rank indicator and interaction
. gen no_school = 0

. replace no_school = 1 if missing(school_rank)
(3,415 real changes made)

. gen school_x_rank = school_rank
(3,415 missing values generated)

. replace school_x_rank = 0 if no_school == 1
(3,415 real changes made)

. * record housing units in msa
. preserve

. collapse (sum) hunits, by(msa msa_name) fast

. * recover city edge
. merge 1:1 msa using ../../data/processed/controls_msa, keepusing(dist2cbd_edg
> e msa_maincity)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------

        from master                         1  (_merge==1)
        from using                         46  (_merge==2)

    -----------------------------------------

. save `tmp_msa', replace
(file /tmp/St10336.000002 not found)

. restore

. merge m:1 msa using `tmp_msa'
(variable hunits was int, now double to accommodate using data's values)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                            46
        from master                         0  (_merge==1)
        from using                         46  (_merge==2)

    -----------------------------------------

. drop _merge

. * drop incomplete observations
. egen miss = rowmiss(contractrent_median `c_neighb' `c_dwelling')

. drop if miss > 0
(20,073 observations deleted)

. drop miss

. * drop beyond msa edge
. drop if dist2cbd > dist2cbd_edge
(8,342 observations deleted)

. * housing price variable
. gen ln_housing_price = ln(contractrent_median)

. * centre neighbourhoood controls by msa and dwelling controls nationally
. if (`centre_controls_msa' == 1) {
.         foreach var of varlist `c_neighb' {
  2.                 bys msa: egen a`var' = mean(`var')
  3.                 gen b`var' =  `var' - a`var'
  4.                 drop `var' a`var'
  5.                 rename b`var' `var'
  6.         }
.         foreach var of varlist `c_dwelling' {
  2.                 egen a`var' = mean(`var')
  3.                 gen b`var' =  `var' - a`var'
  4.                 drop `var' a`var'
  5.                 rename b`var' `var'
  6.         }
. }

. preserve

. clear

. set obs 1
Number of observations (_N) was 0, now 1.

. gen msa_maincity = ""
(1 missing value generated)

. save `tmp_reg', replace
(file /tmp/St10336.000003 not found)
file /tmp/St10336.000003 saved as .dta format

. restore

. foreach city in "New York, NY" "Chicago, IL" "Dallas, TX" "Houston, TX" "Pitt
> sburgh, PA" "Atlanta, GA" "Philadelphia, PA"{
  2.         preserve
  3.         keep if msa_maincity == "`city'"
  4.         *semipar contractrent_median `c_neighb' `c_dwelling', nonpar(dist2
> cbd) kernel(epanechnikov) degree(1) gen(housing_price_fit)
.         plreg contractrent_median `c_neighb' `c_dwelling', nlf(dist2cbd) gen(
> housing_price_fit) nograph
  5.         keep msa msa_name msa_maincity dist2cbd housing_price_fit
  6.         append using `tmp_reg'
  7.         save `tmp_reg', replace
  8.         restore
  9. }

. do hcgrowth_regulation

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
> hcgrowth_regulation.do
> 
> Stata do file to produce regulation plots for
> 'Urban growth and its aggregate implications',
> by Gilles Duranton and Diego Puga
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
. 
. * initialise
. clear

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. 
. tempfile tmp_bg

. tempfile tmp_msa

. tempfile tmp_reg

. 
. * wait on plot
. local sleep_plot = 600

. 
. * set lot size in acres (0.25 acres is US median lot size for new constructio
> n in 2009)
. local lotsize "0.25"

. * set gross profit margin
. local gross_margin "1.17"

. 
. * read hcgrowth_msa_housing from hcgrowth_gamma_theta.do
. use ../../data/intermediate/hcgrowth_msa_housing, clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. Partial housing
>  e)

. erase ../../data/intermediate/hcgrowth_msa_housing.dta

. * merge other msa-level housing data
. merge 1:1 msa using ../../data/processed/housing_msa

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                             0
    Matched                               275  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. drop _merge

. * land cost
. gen cost_land = `lotsize' * 0.404686 * ag_land_value_fringe
(1 missing value generated)

. label var cost_land "Cost of `lotsize' acre lot currently devoted to agricult
> ure"

. * permits
. gen permits_to_stock = permits_2008_2012 / hunits
(46 missing values generated)

. label var permits_to_stock "Annual housing permits 2008-2012 relative to hous
> ing stock"

. * wrluri
. gen wrluri = (8 / 12) * wrluri2006 + (4 / 12) * wrluri2018
(70 missing values generated)

. label var wrluri "Wharton Residential Land Use Regulatory Index (interpolated
>  to 2010)"

. 
. * merge population
. merge 1:1 msa using ../../data/processed/citypop_msa_necma, keepusing(pop2010
> )

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                             0
    Matched                               275  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. gen ln_pop = ln(pop2010)

. drop _merge

. * merge geographical constraints
. merge 1:1 msa using ../../data/processed/controls_msa, keepusing(msa_fringe_c
> onstrained msa_maincity)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                             0
    Matched                               275  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. gen ln_msa_fringe_constrained = asinh(msa_fringe_constrained)

. drop _merge

. * create wedge variable
. gen wedge = housing_value_per - (`gross_margin' * (cost_construction + cost_l
> and))
(143 missing values generated)

. label var wedge "Periphery house price - cost wedge ($)"

. * keep same obs throughout
. egen miss = rowmiss(pop2010 housing_price_per wrluri ln_msa_fringe_constraine
> d wedge permits_to_stock)

. drop if miss > 0
(163 observations deleted)

. drop miss

. count
  112

. preserve

. * save
. order msa msa_name msa_maincity pop2010 msa_fringe_constrained housing_price_
> per ln_housing_price_per housing_value_per ln_housing_value_per cost_construc
> tion cost_land wedge wrluri  permits_to_stock

. keep msa msa_name msa_maincity pop2010 msa_fringe_constrained housing_price_p
> er ln_housing_price_per housing_value_per ln_housing_value_per cost_construct
> ion cost_land wedge wrluri permits_to_stock

. label data "'Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. Ho
> using estimates"

. sort msa

. save ../../results/hcgrowth_fig5_data, replace
(file ../../results/hcgrowth_fig5_data.dta not found)
file ../../results/hcgrowth_fig5_data.dta saved

. describe

file ../../results/hcgrowth_figc1.eps saved as EPS format
