end of do-file

. 
. * prepare specific factors diagram data for mathematica
. do hcgrowth_specfactors

. * initialise
. clear

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. 
. tempfile tmp

. 
. * set parameters
. local sigma  = 0.04

. local beta   = 0.04

. local gamma  = 0.07

. local theta  = 0.04

. local lambda = 0.18

. local rho = 1

. local tau = 1

. 
. *** determine tau to match actual aggregate growth
. set obs 1
Number of observations (_N) was 0, now 1.

. gen msa_name = "extra"

. save `tmp', replace
(file /tmp/St10336.000001 not found)
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. foreach yy in 1980 2010 {
  2.         * begin with actual us cities
.         use ../../data/processed/citypop_msa_necma_wtotal, clear
  3.         keep msa msa_name pop`yy'
  4.         * record total us pop by picking obs with us total
.         sum pop`yy' if msa_name == "Conterminous United States"
  5.         local us_total_pop = r(max)
  6.         * record total msa pop
.         gsort -pop`yy'
  7.         gen long cumpop = sum(pop`yy') if !missing(msa)
  8.         sum cumpop
  9.         local us_msa_pop = r(max)
 10.         drop cumpop
 11.         * record non-msa total
.         local us_rural_pop = `us_total_pop' - `us_msa_pop'
 12.         * z from barriers
.         merge 1:1 msa using ../../data/processed/controls_msa, keepusing(msa_
> cc30km_constrained msa_maincity)
 13.         drop _merge
 14.         gen z = 100/(100 - msa_cc30km_constrained)
 15.         drop msa_cc30km_constrained
 16.         * set tau to 1 for starters
.         gen tau_`yy' = 1
 17.         * use actual population
.         gen long N_`yy'= pop`yy'
 18.         * extra obs for rural and newcomers
.         sum pop`yy'
 19.         local pop_min = r(min)
 20.         expand 2 if pop`yy' == `pop_min', gen(dup)
 21.         replace msa_name = "Rural" if dup == 1
 22.         drop dup
 23.         replace msa = . if msa_name == "Rural"
 24.         * compute c for incumbents (equilibrium relationship only)
.         gen double c_`yy' = ( (`gamma' + `theta' - `sigma' - `beta') / ((`sig
> ma' + `beta') * (`gamma' + 1)) ) * tau_`yy' * z^(`gamma') * ( N_`yy'^(`gamma'
>  + `theta') )
 25.         replace z = . if msa_name == "Rural"
 26.         * rural and newcomer c is equal to c in marginal city
.         sum c_`yy' if msa_name == "Rural"
 27.         local c_rural = r(max)
 28.         * rural population
.         replace N_`yy'= `us_rural_pop' if msa_name == "Rural"
 29.         * compute A based on actual population and z
.         gen double A_`yy' = ( (`gamma' + `theta') / ((`rho'^(`sigma')) * (`si
> gma' + `beta') * (`gamma' + 1)) ) * tau_`yy' * z^(`gamma') * ( N_`yy'^(`gamma
> ' + `theta' - `sigma' - `beta') ) if msa_name != "Rural"
 30.         * compute y
.         gen double y_`yy' = (`rho'^`sigma') * A_`yy' * (N_`yy'^(`sigma' + `be
> ta')) if msa_name != "Rural"
 31.         replace y_`yy' = c_`yy' if msa_name == "Rural"
 32.         * save to tmp file
.         order msa msa_name msa_maincity z A_`yy' tau_`yy' N_`yy' y_`yy' c_`yy
> '
 33.         keep msa msa_name msa_maincity z A_`yy' tau_`yy' N_`yy' y_`yy' c_`
> yy'
 34.         gsort -c_`yy'
 35.         merge 1:1 msa_name using `tmp'
 36.         drop _merge
 37.         replace msa_maincity = "Rural" if msa_name == "Rural"
 38.         save `tmp', replace
 39. }
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. City Sizes USA)

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
     pop1980 |          1    2.25e+08           .   2.25e+08   2.25e+08
(1 missing value generated)

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
      cumpop |        275    1.48e+08    3.07e+07   1.73e+07   1.77e+08

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                             1
        from master                         1  (_merge==1)

. * compare actual growth with model growth from urbanisation alone

. local y_2010 = r(mean)

('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. US totals)

. sum us_gdp_pc if year == 1980

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. dev.       Min        Max

. local us_gdp_pc_1980 = r(mean)

. sum us_gdp_pc if year == 2010

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
   us_gdp_pc |          1       50036           .      50036      50036

. local us_gdp_pc_2010 = r(mean)

. local g_data = `us_gdp_pc_2010' / `us_gdp_pc_1980'

. local g = `g_data' / `g_model'

. display "Growth in tau to match actual output growth:"
Growth in tau to match actual output growth:

. display `g'
1.5686113

. clear

. 
. *** save data for mathematica
. foreach yc in 1980 2010 {
  2.         *** record totals
.         * begin with actual us cities
.         use ../../data/processed/citypop_msa_necma_wtotal, clear
  3.         keep msa msa_name pop1980 pop2010
  4.         * record total us pop by picking obs with us total
.         sum pop`yc' if msa_name == "Conterminous United States"
  5.         local us_total_pop = r(max)
  6.         * record total msa pop
.         gsort -pop`yc'
  7.         gen long cumpop = sum(pop`yc') if !missing(msa)
  8.         sum cumpop
  9.         local us_msa_pop = r(max)
 10.         drop cumpop
 11.         * record non-msa total
.         local us_rural_pop = `us_total_pop' - `us_msa_pop'
 12.         * display
.         display "US total population `yc'"
 13.         disp %9.0f `us_total_pop'
 14.         display "US urban population `yc'"
 15.         disp %9.0f `us_msa_pop'
 16.         display "US rural population `yc'"
 17.         disp %9.0f `us_rural_pop'
 18.         * z from barriers
.         merge 1:1 msa using ../../data/processed/controls_msa, keepusing(msa_
> cc30km_constrained msa_maincity)
 19.         drop _merge
 20.         gen z = 100/(100 - msa_cc30km_constrained)
 21.         drop msa_cc30km_constrained
 22.         * z for inframarginal cities (90th percentile)
.         sum z, detail
 23.         local z_p90 = r(p90)
 24.         order msa msa_name msa_maincity pop`yc' z
 25.         keep msa msa_name msa_maincity pop`yc' z
 26.         ** generate inframarginal cities
.         preserve
 27.         * msa threshold
.         sum pop`yc'
 28.         local pop_min = r(min)
 29.         * estimate zipf coefficient
.         gen lpop = ln(pop`yc')
 30.         egen rank = rank(1/pop`yc')
 31.         gen lrank = ln(rank - 0.5)
 32.         reg lrank lpop if pop`yc' >= `pop_min'
 33.         local p_shape = - _b[lpop]
 34.         * generate additional cities with random populations drawn from pa
> reto
.         clear
 35.         local p_scale = 1000
 36.         set obs 8000
 37.         gen u = runiform()
 38.         gen long N = `p_scale' / ((1 - u)^(1/`p_shape'))
 39.         drop u
 40.         replace N = round(N)
 41.         gen double z = `z_p90'
 42.         gsort -N
 43.         gen long msa = 9900000 + _n
 44.         save `tmp', replace
 45.         restore
 46.         append using `tmp'
 47.         * set N for all
.         replace N = pop`yc' if missing(N)
 48.         * combine, keeping actual cities plus randomly generated less atra
> ctive than marginal msa
.         gen double c = ( (`gamma' + `theta' - `sigma' - `beta') / ((`sigma' +
>  `beta') * (`gamma' + 1)) ) * `tau' * z^(`gamma') * ( N^(`gamma' + `theta') )
 49.         sum c if msa < 9900000
 50.         drop if c > r(min) & !missing(msa) & msa > 9900000
 51.         save `tmp', replace
 52.         /*
>         * zipf plot for combined distribution
>         gen lpop = ln(N)
>         egen rank = rank(1/N)
>         gen lrank = ln(rank)
>         predict lrank_lpop_reg
>         local psfont palatino
>         *twoway (scatter lrank lpop, mcolor(dknavy) msize(vsmall)) (line lran
> k_lpop_reg lpop), plotregion(margin(zero)) legend(off) xsize(7) ysize(5) xtit
> le("ln(Population)") ytitle("ln(Rank)")
>         drop rank lrank lpop lrank_lpop_reg
>         */
.         * add non-msa total
.         set obs `=_N+1'
 53.         replace msa_name = "Non MSA" if missing(msa) & msa_name != "Conter
> minous United States"
 54.         replace pop`yc' = `us_rural_pop' if msa_name == "Non MSA"
 55.         * set N for all
.         replace N = pop`yc' if missing(N)
 56.         drop pop`yc'
 57.         replace c = 0 if msa_name == "Non MSA" | msa_name == "Conterminous
>  United States"
 58.         replace z = 0 if msa_name == "Non MSA" | msa_name == "Conterminous
>  United States"
 59.         replace msa = 9999999 if msa_name == "Non MSA" | msa_name == "Cont
> erminous United States"
 60.         gsort -c -N
 61. 
.         * export for mathematica
.         export delimited msa N z using ../../data/intermediate/specfactors`yc
> '.csv, novarnames replace
 62.         list msa_maincity c N z if _n < 10, nocompress
 63. 
. }
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. City Sizes USA)

. 
. * extra permits counterfactual
. do hcgrowth_counterfact_morepermits

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
> hcgrowth_counterfact_morepermits.do
> 
> Stata do file to evaluate counterfactuals for
> 'Urban growth and its aggregate implications',
> by Gilles Duranton and Diego Puga
> 
> Counterfactual: increase permits
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
. 
. * initialise
. clear

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. 
. tempfile tmp

. tempfile tmp_base

. tempfile tmp_table

. 
. set obs 9
Number of observations (_N) was 0, now 9.

. gen parset = _n

. gen sigma_beta = .
(9 missing values generated)

. gen gamma_theta = .
(9 missing values generated)

. gen pc_y = .
(9 missing values generated)

. gen pc_c = .
(9 missing values generated)

. 
. save `tmp_table', replace
(file /tmp/St10336.000003 not found)
file /tmp/St10336.000003 saved as .dta format

. 
. * loop through parameter sets
. forvalues parset = 1/10 {
  2.         clear
  3.         * set parameters
.         if `parset' == 1 {
  4.                 local sigma  = 0.02
  5.                 local beta   = 0.02
  6.                 local gamma  = 0.06
  7.                 local theta  = 0.03
  8.         }
  9.         else if `parset' == 2 {
 10.                 local sigma  = 0.03
 11.                 local beta   = 0.03
 12.                 local gamma  = 0.06
 13.                 local theta  = 0.03
 14.         }
 15.         else if `parset' == 3 {
 16.                 local sigma  = 0.04
 17.                 local beta   = 0.04
 18.                 local gamma  = 0.06
 19.                 local theta  = 0.03
 20.         }
 21.         else if `parset' == 4 {
 22.                 local sigma  = 0.02
 23.                 local beta   = 0.02
 24.                 local gamma  = 0.07
 25.                 local theta  = 0.04
 26.         }
 27.         else if `parset' == 5 {
 28.                 local sigma  = 0.03
 29.                 local beta   = 0.03
 30.                 local gamma  = 0.07
 31.                 local theta  = 0.04
 32.         }
 33.         else if `parset' == 6 {
 34.                 local sigma  = 0.04
 35.                 local beta   = 0.04
 36.                 local gamma  = 0.07
 37.                 local theta  = 0.04
 38.         }
 39.         else if `parset' == 7 {
 40.                 local sigma  = 0.02
 41.                 local beta   = 0.02
 42.                 local gamma  = 0.08
 43.                 local theta  = 0.05
 44.         }
 45.         else if `parset' == 8 {
 46.                 local sigma  = 0.03
 47.                 local beta   = 0.03
 48.                 local gamma  = 0.08
 49.                 local theta  = 0.05
 50.         }
 51.         else if `parset' == 9 {
 52.                 local sigma  = 0.04
 53.                 local beta   = 0.04
 54.                 local gamma  = 0.08
 55.                 local theta  = 0.05
 56.         }
 57.         * 9 sets for robustness table, 1 extra for main table 
.         else {
 58.                 local sigma  = 0.04
 59.                 local beta   = 0.04
 60.                 local gamma  = 0.07
 61.                 local theta  = 0.04
 62.         }
 63.         * other parameters
.         local lambda = 0.18
 64.         local tau = 1
 65.         local rho = 1
 66.         * maximum feasible city size
.         local pop_max = 40000000
 67. 
.         *** get data for relevant years
.         set obs 1
 68.         gen msa_name = "extra"
 69.         save `tmp_base', replace
 70.         foreach yy in 2010 {
 71.                 * previous generation is 30 years earlier
.                 local yy_pg = `yy' - 30
 72.                 * begin with actual us cities
.                 use ../../data/processed/citypop_msa_necma_wtotal, clear
 73.                 keep msa msa_name pop`yy' pop`yy_pg' pop2010
 74.                 * record total us pop by picking obs with us total
.                 sum pop`yy' if msa_name == "Conterminous United States"
 75.                 local us_total_pop = r(max)
 76.                 * record total msa pop
.                 gsort -pop`yy'
 77.                 gen long cumpop = sum(pop`yy') if !missing(msa)
 78.                 sum cumpop
 79.                 local us_msa_pop = r(max)
 80.                 drop cumpop
 81.                 * record non-msa total
.                 local us_rural_pop = `us_total_pop' - `us_msa_pop'
 82.                 * z from barriers
.                 merge 1:1 msa using ../../data/processed/controls_msa, keepus
> ing(msa_cc30km_constrained msa_maincity)
 83.                 drop _merge
 84.                 gen z = 100/(100 - msa_cc30km_constrained)
 85.                 drop msa_cc30km_constrained
 86.                 * z for inframarginal cities (90th percentile)
.                 sum z, detail
 87.                 local z_p90 = r(p90)
 88.                 order msa msa_name msa_maincity pop`yy_pg' pop`yy' z
 89.                 keep msa msa_name msa_maincity pop`yy_pg' pop`yy' z
 90.                 drop if msa_name == "Conterminous United States"
 91.                 * use actual current year population
.                 gen long N_`yy'= pop`yy'
 92.                 * extra obs for rural and newcomers
.                 sum pop`yy'
 93.                 local pop_min = r(min)
 94.                 expand 2 if pop`yy' == `pop_min', gen(dup)
 95.                 replace msa_name = "Rural and newcomers" if dup == 1
 96.                 drop dup
 97.                 replace msa = . if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
 98.                 * compute c for incumbents (equilibrium relationship only)
.                 gen double c_`yy' = ( (`gamma' + `theta' - `sigma' - `beta') 
> / ((`sigma' + `beta') * (`gamma' + 1)) ) * `tau' * z^(`gamma') * ( N_`yy'^(`g
> amma' + `theta') )
 99.                 replace z = . if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
100.                 * rural and newcomer c is equal to c in marginal city
.                 sum c_`yy' if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
101.                 local c_rural = r(max)
102.                 * incumbent population in each city (min of old generation
>  or current)
.                 gen long N_incumb_`yy' = min(pop`yy' , pop`yy_pg') if !missin
> g(msa)
103.                 * rural population (N_`yy' records rural only, N_incumb_`y
> y' also includes urban newcomers)
.                 replace N_`yy'= `us_rural_pop' if msa_name == "Rural and newc
> omers"
104.                 gen long cumpop = sum(N_incumb_`yy')
105.                 sum cumpop
106.                 replace N_incumb_`yy' = `us_total_pop' - r(max) if msa_nam
> e == "Rural and newcomers"
107.                 drop cumpop
108.                 * compute A based on actual population and z
.                 gen double A_`yy' = ( (`gamma' + `theta') / ((`rho'^(`sigma')
> ) * (`sigma' + `beta') * (`gamma' + 1)) ) * `tau' * z^(`gamma') * ( N_`yy'^(`
> gamma' + `theta' - `sigma' - `beta') ) if msa_name != "Rural and newcomers"
109.                 * compute y
.                 gen double y_`yy' = (`rho'^`sigma') * A_`yy' * (N_`yy'^(`sigm
> a' + `beta')) if msa_name != "Rural and newcomers"
110.                 replace y_`yy' = c_`yy' if msa_name == "Rural and newcomer
> s"
111.                 * permitting costs
.                 gen double p_`yy' = c_`yy' - `c_rural' if msa_name != "Rural 
> and newcomers"
112.                 * save baseline to tmp file
.                 order msa msa_name msa_maincity z A_`yy' N_`yy' N_incumb_`yy'
>  y_`yy' c_`yy' p_`yy'
113.                 keep msa msa_name msa_maincity z A_`yy' N_`yy' N_incumb_`y
> y' y_`yy' c_`yy' p_`yy'
114.                 merge 1:1 msa_name using `tmp_base'
115.                 drop _merge
116.                 replace msa_maincity = "Rural and newcomers" if msa_name =
> = "Rural and newcomers"
117.                 drop if msa_name == "extra"
118.                 gsort -c_`yy' msa
119.                 save `tmp_base', replace
120.         }
121. 
.         *** baseline
.         local yb = 2010
122.         foreach cfvar in N N_incumb {
123.                 gen long `cfvar'_base = `cfvar'_`yb'
124.         }
125.         foreach cfvar in y c p {
126.                 gen double `cfvar'_base = `cfvar'_`yb'
127.         }
128.         gen A = A_`yb'
129.         save `tmp_base', replace
130.         * record total msa pop
.         gsort -N_base
131.         gen long cumpop = sum(N_base) if !missing(msa)
132.         sum cumpop
133.         local us_msa_pop = r(max)
134.         drop cumpop
135.         * recall rural pop
.         sum N_base if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers", meanonly
136.         local us_rural_pop = r(mean)
137.         * recall total us pop
.         local us_total_pop = `us_msa_pop' + `us_rural_pop'
138.         * display
.         disp "Total: " %9.0f `us_total_pop'
139.         disp "Urban: " %9.0f `us_msa_pop'
140.         disp "Rural: " %9.0f `us_rural_pop'
141.         * compute rural A
.         sum c_base if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers", meanonly
142.         local c_rural = r(mean)
143.         local A_rural = `c_rural' * (`us_rural_pop'^(`lambda'))
144.         disp "A_r = " `A_rural'
145. 
.         *** define counterfactual
.         * keep only msas (actual and counterfactual)
.         drop if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
146.         preserve
147.         * calculate population with increased permitting
.         * get permitting rate
.         use ../../data/processed/housing_msa, clear
148.         keep msa msa_name permit_rate_1980_2010
149.         * merge population
.         merge 1:1 msa using ../../data/processed/citypop_msa_necma, keepusing
> (pop1980 pop2010)
150.         drop _merge
151.         * merge wedge
.         merge 1:1 msa using ../../results/hcgrowth_fig5_data, keepusing(msa_m
> aincity wedge)
152.         * target cities with wedge > 200,000 and population > 3 million
.         gen affected_cfact = 0
153.         replace affected_cfact = 1 if wedge >= 200000 & pop2010 > 3000000
154.         gsort -wedge
155.         list msa_maincity wedge pop2010 if affected_cfact == 1
156.         * set their permitting rate to at least top quartile
.         sum permit_rate_1980_2010, detail
157.         local permit_rate_cfact = r(p75)
158.         disp `permit_rate_cfact'
159.         replace affected_cfact = 0 if permit_rate_1980_2010 >= `permit_rat
> e_cfact'
160.         sum permit_rate_1980_2010 if affected_cfact == 1, detail
161.         * calculate counterfactual populations
.         gen N = pop2010
162.         replace N = int((`permit_rate_cfact' / permit_rate_1980_2010) * (p
> op2010 - pop1980) + pop1980) if affected_cfact == 1
163.         format N %9.0f
164.         keep msa msa_name N affected_cfact permit_rate_1980_2010
165.         save `tmp', replace
166.         restore
167.         merge 1:1 msa using `tmp', keepusing(N affected_cfact permit_rate_
> 1980_2010)
168.         drop _merge
169. 
.         * drop cities one by one to find new marginal city
.         gen long N_cfact = .
170.         gen long N_cfact_uncapped = .
171.         gen long N_marg = .
172.         gen double y_cfact = .
173.         gen double c_cfact = .
174.         gen long cityorder = .
175.         gen double c_rural_cut = .
176.         gen long cumpop = .
177.         local mc_last = 0
178.         count
179.         local cities = r(N)
180.         local mc = `cities'
181.         local cm = `c_rural'
182.         local cm_last = `c_rural' + 1
183.         local i = 1
184.         while ((`i' < `cities') & (`mc' > 1)) {
185.                 quietly {
186.                 * reset counterfactual population
.                 replace N_cfact = .
187.                 * reset marginal city population
.                 replace N_marg = .
188.                 * counterfactual population
.                 replace N_cfact = N_base if affected_cfact == 0
189.                 replace N_cfact = N if affected_cfact == 1
190.                 * counterfactual income and incumbent consumption
.                 replace y_cfact = (`rho'^`sigma') * A * (N_cfact^(`sigma' + `
> beta'))
191.                 replace c_cfact = y_cfact - (1 / (`gamma' + 1)) * `tau' * 
> z^(`gamma') * (N_cfact^(`gamma' + `theta'))
192.                 * sort cities from highest to lowest incumbent consumption
.                 gsort -c_cfact
193.                 replace cityorder = _n
194.                 * cumulative urban population
.                 replace cumpop = sum(N_cfact)
195.                 * urban population cannot exceed us total
.                 replace N_cfact = . if cumpop > `us_total_pop'
196.                 * only cities above current marginal try are populated
.                 replace N_cfact = . if cityorder > `mc'
197.                 * calculate rural consumption if each city were the margin
> al one
.                 replace c_rural_cut = `A_rural' * ( (`us_total_pop' - cumpop)
> ^(-`lambda') )
198.                 * update incumbent consumption in marginal city
.                 local cm_last = `cm'
199.                 sum c_cfact if cityorder == `mc'
200.                 local cm = r(mean)
201.                 }
202.                 disp "it `i', c: `cm'|`cm_last', cities: `mc'"
203.                 * if marginal city implies urban population larger than us
>  population, take out one more city
.                 local mc_last = `mc'
204.                 if (missing(N_cfact[`mc'])) {
205.                         local mc = `mc' - 1
206.                 }
207.                 * or, if marginal city implies rural consumption higher th
> an marginal city incumbent consumption, take out one more city
.                 else {
208.                         if (c_rural_cut[`mc'] > c_cfact[`mc']) {
209.                                 local mc = `mc' - 1
210.                         }
211.                         else {
212.                                 local mc = 0
213.                         }
214.                 }
215.                 local i = `i' + 1
216.         }
217. 
.         * set empty cities
.         replace y_cfact = . if missing(N_cfact)
218.         replace c_cfact = . if missing(N_cfact)
219.         * extra obs for rural areas
.         preserve
220.         use `tmp_base', clear
221.         keep if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
222.         save `tmp', replace
223.         restore
224.         append using `tmp'
225.         * rural consumption
.         sum c_rural_cut if !missing(N_cfact)
226.         replace c_cfact = r(max) if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
227.         replace y_cfact = c_cfact if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
228.         * permitting costs
.         gen p_cfact = c_cfact - r(max) if msa_name != "Rural and newcomers"
229.         * incumbent population in each city (min of previous generation or
>  counterfactual)
.         gen long N_incumb_cfact = min(N_cfact , N_incumb_base) if !missing(ms
> a)
230.         * rural population (N_cfact records rural only, N_incumb_cfact als
> o includes urban newcomers)
.         replace cumpop = sum(N_cfact)
231.         sum cumpop
232.         replace N_cfact = `us_total_pop' - r(max) if msa_name == "Rural an
> d newcomers"
233.         replace cumpop = sum(N_incumb_cfact)
234.         sum cumpop
235.         replace N_incumb_cfact = `us_total_pop' - r(max) if msa_name == "R
> ural and newcomers"
236.         drop cityorder N_cfact_uncapped N_marg c_rural_cut cumpop
237.         order msa msa_name msa_maincity N_base N_cfact N_incumb_base N_inc
> umb_cfact c_base c_cfact y_base y_cfact p_base p_cfact
238. 
.         * weighted national average y, baseline
.         sum y_base [fweight=N_base], meanonly
239.         local y_base = r(mean)
240.         * weighted national average c (N_incumb_base also includes urban n
> ewcomers), baseline
.         sum c_base [fweight=N_incumb_base], meanonly
241.         local c_base = r(mean)
242.         * weighted national average y, counterfactual
.         sum y_cfact [fweight=N_cfact], meanonly
243.         local y_cfact = r(mean)
244.         * weighted national average c (N_incumb_cfact also includes urban 
> newcomers), counterfactual
.         sum c_cfact [fweight=N_incumb_cfact], meanonly
245.         local c_cfact = r(mean)
246.         * percentage changes for individual cities
.         gen pc_y = 100 * (y_cfact - y_base) / y_base
247.         gen pc_c = 100 * (c_cfact - c_base) / c_base
248.         gen pc_permits = 100 * (`permit_rate_cfact' - permit_rate_1980_201
> 0) / permit_rate_1980_2010
249.         * change in c for newcomers
.         sum pc_c if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
250.         gen pc_c_nc = r(mean)
251.         * save for use by hcgrowth_text_results.do
.         gsort -affected_cfact -c_base
252.         save ../../data/intermediate/cfact_morepermits, replace
253. 
.         * format variables
.         gen N_base_th = N_base / 1000
254.         gen N_cfact_th = N_cfact / 1000
255.         format %9.1f pc_permits
256.         format %12.0fc N_base N_cfact N_base_th N_cfact_th
257.         format %9.2f pc_y pc_c_nc
258.         format %9.3f pc_c
259.         * sort from highest to lowest counterfactual populations
.         gen ind_rural = 0
260.         replace ind_rural = 1 if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
261.         gsort ind_rural -N_cfact
262.         
.         * save results to robustness table
.         if `parset' <= 9 {
263.                 use `tmp_table', clear
264.                 replace pc_y = 100* ((`y_cfact' - `y_base') / `y_base') if
>  parset == `parset'
265.                 replace pc_c = 100* ((`c_cfact' - `c_base') / `c_base') if
>  parset == `parset'
266.                 replace sigma_beta = `sigma' + `beta' if parset == `parset
> '
267.                 replace gamma_theta = `gamma' + `theta' if parset == `pars
> et'
268.                 save `tmp_table', replace
269.         }
270.         
. * end of loop through parameter sets
. }
Number of observations (_N) was 0, now 1.

it 1, c: 1.271643610251889|1.271643695584629, cities: 275

. 
. * produce latex table 3
. gen str1 ampersand = "&"

. gen str2 percent = "\%"

. gen str4 slash = "\\"

. split msa_maincity, parse(,)
variables created as string: 
msa_mainci~1  msa_mainci~2

. gen state = substr(msa_maincity,-2,2)

. replace msa_maincity = msa_maincity1 + ", \textsc{" + lower(state) + "}"
variable msa_maincity was str21 now str32
(276 real changes made)

. replace pc_c = . if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
(1 real change made, 1 to missing)

. replace pc_c_nc = .  if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
(1 real change made, 1 to missing)

. replace msa_maincity = "Rural areas"  if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
(1 real change made)

. outsheet msa_maincity ampersand pc_permits percent ampersand N_base_th ampers
> and N_cfact_th ampersand pc_y percent ampersand pc_c percent ampersand pc_c_n
> c percent slash if affected_cfact == 1 | msa_name == "Rural and newcomers" us
> ing ../../results/hcgrowth_table3.tex, nonames noquote replace
(file ../../results/hcgrowth_table3.tex not found)

. shell sed 's/\t*\\%/\\%/g' "../../results/hcgrowth_table3.tex" > "../../resul
> ts/hcgrowth_table3_.tex"


. shell sed -re 's/([0-9])([0-9]{3})($|[^0-9])/\1,\2\3/g' "../../results/hcgrow
> th_table3_.tex" > "../../results/hcgrowth_table3.tex"


. shell sed 's/\&\\%/\&/g' "../../results/hcgrowth_table3.tex" > "../../results
> /hcgrowth_table3_.tex"


. copy "../../results/hcgrowth_table3_.tex" "../../results/hcgrowth_table3.tex"
> , replace

. erase "../../results/hcgrowth_table3_.tex"

. 
. * produce latex table c2
. use `tmp_table', clear

. forvalues parset = 1/9 {
  2.         local sigma_beta_`parset' : di %4.2f sigma_beta[`parset']
  3.         local gamma_theta_`parset' : di %4.2f gamma_theta[`parset']
  4.         local c`parset' : di %4.2f pc_c[`parset']
  5.         local y`parset' : di %4.2f pc_y[`parset']
  6. }

. 
. file open texfile using ../../results/hcgrowth_tablec2.tex, write replace
(file ../../results/hcgrowth_tablec2.tex not found)

. file write texfile "& & & \multicolumn{3}{c}{$\sigma+\beta$}\\" _n

. file write texfile "\cmidrule(r){4-6}" _n

. file write texfile "& & & `sigma_beta_1' & `sigma_beta_2' & `sigma_beta_3'\\"
>  _n

. file write texfile "\toprule" _n

. file write texfile "& `gamma_theta_1' & consumption & `c1'\% & `c2'\% & `c3'\
> %\\" _n

. file write texfile "& & output & `y1'\% & `y2'\% & `y3'\%\\" _n

. file write texfile "\cmidrule(r){2-6}" _n

. file write texfile "$\gamma+\theta$ & `gamma_theta_4' & consumption & `c4'\% 
> & `c5'\% & `c6'\%\\" _n

. file write texfile "& & output & `y4'\% & `y5'\% & `y6'\%\\" _n

. file write texfile "\cmidrule(r){2-6}" _n

. file write texfile "& `gamma_theta_7' & consumption & `c7'\% & `c8'\% & `c9'\
> %\\" _n

. file write texfile "& & output & `y7'\% & `y8'\% & `y9'\%\\" _n

. file close texfile

. 
. 
. 
end of do-file

. 
. * numbers mentioned in the text
. do hcgrowth_text_results

. /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
> hcgrowth_text_results.do
> 
> Stata do file to produce numbers mentioned in the text of the article
> 'Urban growth and its aggregate implications',
> by Gilles Duranton and Diego Puga
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
. 
. * initialise
. clear

. set more off

. set varabbrev off

. 
. tempfile tmp

. tempfile tmp_base

. 
. *** set parameters
. local sigma  = 0.04

. local beta   = 0.04

. local gamma  = 0.07

. local theta  = 0.04

. local lambda = 0.18

. local rho = 1

. local tau = 1

. 
. *** section 3
. 
. ** us population growth
. use ../../data/processed/citypop_msa_necma_wtotal
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. City Sizes USA)

. summarize pop1980 if msa_name == "Conterminous United States", meanonly

. local tr_uspop1980 : display %3.0f (10^-6)*`r(mean)'

. summarize pop2010 if msa_name == "Conterminous United States", meanonly

. local tr_uspop2010 : display %3.0f (10^-6)*`r(mean)'

. 
. ** most attractive cities
. * population
. use ../../data/processed/citypop_msa_necma_wtotal, clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. City Sizes USA)

. keep msa msa_name pop1980 pop2010

. * z
. merge 1:1 msa using ../../data/processed/controls_msa, keepusing(msa_cc30km_c
> onstrained msa_maincity)

    Result                      Number of obs
    -----------------------------------------
    Not matched                             1
        from master                         1  (_merge==1)
        from using                          0  (_merge==2)

    Matched                               275  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. drop _merge

. gen z = 100/(100 - msa_cc30km_constrained)
(1 missing value generated)

. drop msa_cc30km_constrained

. * city names
. split msa_maincity, parse(,)
variables created as string: 
msa_mainci~1  msa_mainci~2

. replace msa_maincity = msa_maincity1 if msa_maincity2 != " DC"
(274 real changes made)

. * consumption 1980
. gen double c1980 = ( (`gamma' + `theta' - `sigma' - `beta') / ((`sigma' + `be
> ta') * (`gamma' + 1)) ) * `tau' * z^(`gamma') * ( pop1980^(`gamma' + `theta')
>  )
(1 missing value generated)

. gsort -c1980

. forval cpos = 1/8 {
  2.         local tr_c1980_n`cpos' = msa_maincity[`cpos']
  3.         display "`tr_c1980_n`cpos''"
  4. }
New York
Los Angeles
San Francisco
Chicago
Detroit
Boston
Washington, DC
Philadelphia

. gen double c2010 = ( (`gamma' + `theta' - `sigma' - `beta') / ((`sigma' + `be
> ta') * (`gamma' + 1)) ) * `tau' * z^(`gamma') * ( pop2010^(`gamma' + `theta')
>  )
(1 missing value generated)

. gsort -c2010

. forval cpos = 1/8 {
  2.         local tr_c2010_n`cpos' = msa_maincity[`cpos']
  3.         display "`tr_c2010_n`cpos''"
  4. }
New York
Los Angeles
San Francisco
Chicago
Washington, DC
Boston
Miami
Detroit

. 
. *** section 4
. 
. ** college share
. * read cps data
. use ../../data/processed/ipums_cps, clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. CPS)

. * college indicator
. gen college = 1 if educ >= 110 & age >= 25
(2,139,569 missing values generated)

. replace college = 0 if missing(college) & age >= 25
(2,139,569 real changes made)

. * drop outside of metro areas
. drop if missing(msa) & (metro == 1 | metarea >= 9997)
(833,973 observations deleted)

. * first aggregate by city size categories
. preserve

. gen size = .
(2,141,504 missing values generated)

. replace size = 1 if !missing(msa) & msa_pop2010 < 1000000
(454,687 real changes made)

. replace size = 2 if !missing(msa) & msa_pop2010 >= 1000000 & msa_pop2010 <= 2
> 500000
(302,448 real changes made)

. replace size = 3 if !missing(msa) & msa_pop2010 > 2500000
(623,163 real changes made)

. replace size = 1 if missing(size) & (msacmsz >= 1 & msacmsz <= 3)

. *** section 8: effect of agglomeration economies
. 
. ** effect of agglomeration economies on aggregate output growth
. * annual gdp per capita growth
. use ../../data/processed/us_nation_totals, clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. US totals)

> 0')^(1/(2010-1950)) -1)*100

> 0')^(1/(2010-1950)) -1)*100

. * annual population growth
. use ../../data/processed/citypop_msa_necma, clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. City Sizes USA)

. keep msa msa_name pop1950 pop2010

. gen ag_pop_1950_2010 = ((pop2010 / pop1950)^(1/(2010-1950)) -1)*100

. sum ag_pop_1950_2010, meanonly

. local ag_pop_1950_2010 : display %3.1f r(mean)

. 
. *** section 8: spatial reallocation counterfactual
. 
. ** determine tau to match actual aggregate growth (income growth increases va
> lue of travel time)
. clear

. set obs 1
Number of observations (_N) was 0, now 1.

. gen msa_name = "extra"

. save `tmp', replace
(file /tmp/St10336.000001 not found)
file /tmp/St10336.000001 saved as .dta format

. foreach yy in 1950 2010 {
  2.         * begin with actual us cities
.         use ../../data/processed/citypop_msa_necma_wtotal, clear
  3.         keep msa msa_name pop`yy'
  4.         * record total us pop by picking obs with us total
.         sum pop`yy' if msa_name == "Conterminous United States"
  5.         local us_total_pop = r(max)
  6.         * record total msa pop
.         gsort -pop`yy'
  7.         gen long cumpop = sum(pop`yy') if !missing(msa)
  8.         sum cumpop
  9.         local us_msa_pop = r(max)
 10.         drop cumpop
 11.         * record non-msa total
.         local us_rural_pop = `us_total_pop' - `us_msa_pop'
 12.         * z from barriers
.         merge 1:1 msa using ../../data/processed/controls_msa, keepusing(msa_
> cc30km_constrained msa_maincity)
 13.         drop _merge
 14.         gen z = 100/(100 - msa_cc30km_constrained)
 15.         drop msa_cc30km_constrained
 16.         * set tau to 1 for starters
.         gen tau_`yy' = 1
 17.         * use actual population
.         gen long N_`yy'= pop`yy'
 18.         * extra obs for rural and newcomers
.         sum pop`yy'
 19.         local pop_min = r(min)
 20.         expand 2 if pop`yy' == `pop_min', gen(dup)
 21.         replace msa_name = "Rural" if dup == 1
 22.         drop dup
 23.         replace msa = . if msa_name == "Rural"
 24.         * compute c for incumbents (equilibrium relationship only)
.         gen double c_`yy' = ( (`gamma' + `theta' - `sigma' - `beta') / ((`sig
> ma' + `beta') * (`gamma' + 1)) ) * tau_`yy' * z^(`gamma') * ( N_`yy'^(`gamma'
>  + `theta') )
 25.         replace z = . if msa_name == "Rural"
 26.         * rural and newcomer c is equal to c in marginal city
.         sum c_`yy' if msa_name == "Rural"
 27.         local c_rural = r(max)
 28.         * rural population
.         replace N_`yy'= `us_rural_pop' if msa_name == "Rural"
 29.         * compute A based on actual population and z
.         gen double A_`yy' = ( (`gamma' + `theta') / ((`rho'^(`sigma')) * (`si
> gma' + `beta') * (`gamma' + 1)) ) * tau_`yy' * z^(`gamma') * ( N_`yy'^(`gamma
> ' + `theta' - `sigma' - `beta') ) if msa_name != "Rural"
 30.         * compute y
.         gen double y_`yy' = (`rho'^`sigma') * A_`yy' * (N_`yy'^(`sigma' + `be
> ta')) if msa_name != "Rural"
 31.         replace y_`yy' = c_`yy' if msa_name == "Rural"
 32.         * save to tmp file
.         order msa msa_name msa_maincity z A_`yy' tau_`yy' N_`yy' y_`yy' c_`yy
> '
 33.         keep msa msa_name msa_maincity z A_`yy' tau_`yy' N_`yy' y_`yy' c_`
> yy'
 34.         gsort -c_`yy'
 35.         merge 1:1 msa_name using `tmp'
 36.         drop _merge
 37.         replace msa_maincity = "Rural" if msa_name == "Rural"
 38.         save `tmp', replace
 39. }
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. City Sizes USA)

. * compare actual growth with model growth from urbanisation alone

. use ../../data/processed/us_nation_totals, clear
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. US totals)

. sum us_gdp_pc if year == 1950

. local us_gdp_pc_2010 = r(mean)

. local g_data = `us_gdp_pc_2010' / `us_gdp_pc_1950'

. local g = `g_data' / `g_model'

. display "Growth in tau to match actual output growth:"
Growth in tau to match actual output growth:

. display `g'
2.8834127

. 
. ** get data for relevant years
. clear

. set obs 1
Number of observations (_N) was 0, now 1.

. gen msa_name = "extra"

. save `tmp_base', replace
(file /tmp/St10336.000002 not found)
file /tmp/St10336.000002 saved as .dta format

. foreach yy in 1950 2010 {
  2.         * previous generation is 30 years earlier
.         local yy_pg = `yy' - 30
  3.         * begin with actual us cities
.         use ../../data/processed/citypop_msa_necma_wtotal, clear
  4.         keep msa msa_name pop`yy' pop`yy_pg' pop2010
  5.         * record total us pop by picking obs with us total
.         sum pop`yy' if msa_name == "Conterminous United States"
  6.         local us_total_pop = r(max)
  7.         * record total msa pop
.         gsort -pop`yy'
  8.         gen long cumpop = sum(pop`yy') if !missing(msa)
  9.         sum cumpop
 10.         local us_msa_pop = r(max)
 11.         drop cumpop
 12.         * record non-msa total
.         local us_rural_pop = `us_total_pop' - `us_msa_pop'
 13.         * z from barriers
.         merge 1:1 msa using ../../data/processed/controls_msa, keepusing(msa_
> cc30km_constrained msa_maincity)
 14.         drop _merge
 15.         gen z = 100/(100 - msa_cc30km_constrained)
 16.         drop msa_cc30km_constrained
 17.         * z for inframarginal cities (90th percentile)
.         sum z, detail
 18.         local z_p90 = r(p90)
 19.         order msa msa_name msa_maincity pop`yy_pg' pop`yy' z
 20.         keep msa msa_name msa_maincity pop`yy_pg' pop`yy' z
 21.         drop if msa_name == "Conterminous United States"
 22.         * set tau to match actual growth
.         gen tau_`yy' = 1
 23.         replace tau_`yy' = `g' if `yy' == 2010
 24.         * use actual current year population
.         gen long N_`yy'= pop`yy'
 25.         * extra obs for rural and newcomers
.         sum pop`yy'
 26.         local pop_min = r(min)
 27.         expand 2 if pop`yy' == `pop_min', gen(dup)
 28.         replace msa_name = "Rural and newcomers" if dup == 1
 29.         drop dup
 30.         replace msa = . if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
 31.         * compute c for incumbents (equilibrium relationship only)
.         gen double c_`yy' = ( (`gamma' + `theta' - `sigma' - `beta') / ((`sig
> ma' + `beta') * (`gamma' + 1)) ) * tau_`yy' * z^(`gamma') * ( N_`yy'^(`gamma'
>  + `theta') )
 32.         replace z = . if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
 33.         * rural and newcomer c is equal to c in marginal city
.         sum c_`yy' if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
 34.         local c_rural = r(max)
 35.         * incumbent population in each city (min of old generation or curr
> ent)
.         gen long N_incumb_`yy' = min(pop`yy' , pop`yy_pg') if !missing(msa)
 36.         * rural population (N_`yy' records rural only, N_incumb_`yy' also 
> includes urban newcomers)
.         replace N_`yy'= `us_rural_pop' if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
 37.         gen long cumpop = sum(N_incumb_`yy')
 38.         sum cumpop
 39.         replace N_incumb_`yy' = `us_total_pop' - r(max) if msa_name == "Ru
> ral and newcomers"
 40.         drop cumpop
 41.         * compute A based on actual population and z
.         gen double A_`yy' = ( (`gamma' + `theta') / ((`rho'^(`sigma')) * (`si
> gma' + `beta') * (`gamma' + 1)) ) * tau_`yy' * z^(`gamma') * ( N_`yy'^(`gamma
> ' + `theta' - `sigma' - `beta') ) if msa_name != "Rural and newcomers"
 42.         * compute y
.         gen double y_`yy' = (`rho'^`sigma') * A_`yy' * (N_`yy'^(`sigma' + `be
> ta')) if msa_name != "Rural and newcomers"
 43.         replace y_`yy' = c_`yy' if msa_name == "Rural and newcomers"
 44.         * permitting costs
.         gen double p_`yy' = c_`yy' - `c_rural' if msa_name != "Rural and newc
> omers"
 45.         * save baseline to tmp file
.         order msa msa_name msa_maincity z A_`yy' tau_`yy' N_`yy' N_incumb_`yy
> ' y_`yy' c_`yy' p_`yy'
 46.         keep msa msa_name msa_maincity z A_`yy' tau_`yy' N_`yy' N_incumb_`
> yy' y_`yy' c_`yy' p_`yy'
 47.         gsort -c_`yy'
 48.         merge 1:1 msa_name using `tmp_base'
 49.         drop _merge
 50.         replace msa_maincity = "Rural and newcomers" if msa_name == "Rural
>  and newcomers"
 51.         save `tmp_base', replace
 52. }
('Urban growth and its aggregate implications' Duranton & Puga. City Sizes USA)

> msa)

> zen cities

     1.84

. * counterfactual growth in US GDP per person with constant population and wit
> hout frozen cities
. display %9.2f ((`y_base'/`y_1950')^(1/(`yb' - 1950)) -1)*100
     2.50

. * reported result: extra percentage points output growth from reallocation
. local tr_cfact_pop1950_pl_y_2c : display %3.1f ((`y_base'/`y_1950')^(1/(`yb' 
> - 1950)) -1)*100 - ((`y_cfact'/`y_1950')^(1/(`yb' - 1950)) -1)*100

. 
. *** output numbers given in the text to text file
. file open txtfile using ../../results/hcgrowth_text_results.txt, write replac
> e
(file ../../results/hcgrowth_text_results.txt not found)

. file write txtfile "'Urban growth and its aggregate implications'," _n

. file write txtfile "by Gilles Duranton and Diego Puga" _n

. file write txtfile _n

. file write txtfile "Results mentioned in the text not contained in tables." _
> n

. file write txtfile _n

. file write txtfile "Introduction" _n

. file write txtfile _n

. file write txtfile "This relaxation allows for more construction and, in turn
> , leads to a" _n

. file write txtfile "counterfactual increase in population of up to `tr_cfact_
> permits_pcpop_ny'% in New York and `tr_cfact_permits_pcpop_avg7'% on" _n

. file write txtfile "average in the seven cities." _n

. file write txtfile _n

. file write txtfile "Section 3" _n

. file write txtfile _n

. file write txtfile "The increased distance between the two vertical axes in p
> anel B relative to" _n

. file write txtfile "panel A represents the growth in total population from `t
> r_uspop1980' million in 1980 to" _n

> `tr_c2010_n5', `tr_c2010_n6', and" _n
